description:
How have I lived up the street from this place for so long and only been here once?  Second time in 10 years is a charm, I guess!

GO FOR HAPPY HOUR.  You can get a whole lot of good for like half the price!  Appetizers, rolls, sake, house wine - a pretty good selection of faves that you'd order off the regular menu!  

With that being said, the food is DELICIOUS!  And veggie-friendly :) . DEFINITELY go for:
-Garlic Edamame - these are straight-up addicting.
-Agadashi Tofu (sans fish flakes for me)
-Grasshopper Roll - this roll is vegetarian perfection!  Sweet potatos with avocado and spicy sauce!  I couldn't help myself but to eat all 8 pieces in one sitting
-Hot sake (a large is only $4.50 during happy hour!)

Ambiance is pretty dark and club-like to me.  But overall pretty casual.

Did I mention happy hour is every day?  There's no excuse...get into it!
author: Angella S.

description:
Happy Hour here is incredible. Definitely decreases the price of the rolls (which is very nice). We started off with some appetizers - the pork gyoza was absolutely delicatable and the tempura was alright. 
In terms of sushi rolls, they are a great size and seem super fresh. We had the California Roll (classic) that was packed with flavor, a Boston Roll which was top notch and the 49er roll (love me some lemon on sushi and no seaweed on it which let the flavor of the salmon shine). 
A bit expensive outside of Happy Hour but a great selection and taste.
author: Joolia M.

description:
The pieces were 2" x 1" x .5", which is a good size. There was one of each type of fish, which was a good amount of variety. 8 pieces of fish and 2 pieces of tamago, for 10 pieces total for $18.

Mm, that salmon was just the right amount of fatty and salmon-y. The tuna was a deep red color and not fishy in the least. The fattier tuna was a good amount of fatty. The yellowtail had really good flavor, and was also buttery. The halibut was also super soft and tasty. I quickly gobbled up all of the other fish. That was just what I needed after a day of the fun that is apartment hunting. 

They also threw in a well-dressed sesame mayo dressing on romaine, as well as a particularly large miso soup.
author: Nicole H.

description:
We came here before seeing a show at the Castro Theatre. It was a Saturday night around 645 and all the tables were full but luckily there was no wait so we get the first available table within a few minutes. 

The service wasn't overall friendly but they we by no means rude. We ordered the shrimp tempura appetizer and a large hot sake to start. The tempura was good except for one piece of some type of squash that was super undercooked and crunchy. The sake was not bad for $7, the large was around 4 small cups. 

For our main rolls we had the shrimp tempura and the rainbow roll. My wife gets the shrimp tempura roll every time we get sushi and she did not like this one at all. I finished it for her and agree that it definitely was not great. I however did love the Rainbow roll. The California base was flavorful and the assorted fish on top was fresh. 

For the app, the sake, and 2 rolls it was less than $40. I consider that a pretty good deal and I would return for sushi when in the mood.
author: Danielle B.

description:
Walking in, there's always a pleasant welcome. The menu has so many wonderful choices, page after page. Big appetite, small appetite, all are welcome. My favorite choice are the oysters. Always fresh and so tasty, the sweetness combining with the brineyness beautifully. The sushi is always delicious and fresh. Service is attentive and helpful. Great saki flights.
Enjoy!
author: William M.

description: I came in today at around 7pm with my friend for dinner, but I usually order takeout. I always order the caterpillar roll every time I have sushi. Along with that we also ordered a dragon roll , the double tuna roll, and the rainbow carpaccio. All of the rolls were super delicious and we loved it so much that we were able to finish everything even though we were quite full. The rainbow carpaccio was delicious and the fish was really fresh. I was tempted to order a second oneWe also ordered the oyster shooter, which didn't really come out as I have expected. It definitely wasn't for me because it had sake in it and it just wasn't as flavorful as other oyster shooters I've had. The ambiance was really nice, lots of space and the servers were very friendly and made sure to always come take our plates and came back to take more of our orders even before we called for them. On top of that, they also gave us a bottle of sake on the house which was super friendly and unexpected! Definitely would come back and try more of their other rolls!
author: Mandy C.

description: Great happy hour deals! We ordered a total of 8 hand rolls, agedashi tofu, a large hot sake, and coke all for under $40! They have a wide selection of items for happy hour like hand rolls, regular rolls, hot appetizers (tempura, agedashi tofu, karaage, etc.), and beer and sake. We had ordered the spicy tuna, spicy scallop, salmon skin, and unagi hand rolls. Out of those four, the unagi and salmon skin were the best. The spicy tuna and spicy scallop were of good quality, but there was not enough flavor or spice to the mixture. I do have to applaud the sushi chefs for not having any sinew in the spicy tuna! Some places that we've been to have sinew in the mixture which makes the texture unpleasant. Even though the sushi isn't as good in overall flavor quality, we'll definitely be back here for the happy hour bargain and friendly staff.
author: Aimee I.

description:
Stumbled upon wasabi bistro when I was wandering the streets of Castro District in SF. 

The service is impeccable. They are all so friendly and give you recommendations if you want them. The owner even came up to me to see how I liked everything. 

I grabbed a seat at the sushi bar to grab a glass of wine and a few appetizers before meeting up with my friends and I'm so glad I did. 

I was recommended the toro nigiri, which I've never had before. It's basically the fatty part of the tuna. Welp, I've found my new favorite nigiri. Thank you Wasabi Bistro! Also their garlic edamame is full of flavor and cooked to perfection. 

If you're in the area definitely stop in. Their friendly smiles & amazingly fresh sushi will get you hooked!
author: Maggie A.

description:
Sooo, I live down the street and have walked by a  bajillion times. I was unimpressed by the decor and specials board. Meh. Faux Japanese food? I'll pass.

Then a few nights ago I wanted to watch the end of the Warrior's game, and The Mix and Harvey's didn't have it on. Okay, Takara we thought....but no they closed early. On our dejected shuffle home we passed Wasabi for the bijillion +1 times. And they were playing basketball on the tv over the bar! Wrong game, but would they change it? They would!

We ordered beer, a couple of rolls and tempura. The tempura was imaginative with shishito peppers and asparagus in addition to the regular stuff. But I didn't love it because it was greasy.

BUT oh my god the rolls were incredible!!
We had double hamachi and rainbow and they were wow wow wow good. The sushi chef said he works every night...

So now you know-get the sushi any night of the week.  He who hates on mediocre Japanese food was raving too.
author: El B.

description:
Wasabi Bistro is one of my favorite sushi restaurant in the Castro. Staff are friendly and I like the decor of the restaurant. 

Sashimi is fresh! Happy hour before 6:30. The oysters are so fresh and so good!I get it every time I come here! The garlic shrimp is very flavorful!

You can also watch sports as well! 

Sushi Chef Charles is super friendly, skillful and knowledgable. 

Highly recommend! Sometimes they do get packed so I always call to reserve a table.
author: Tammy F.

description:
*** Update 03/21/18***
Was here for a revisit. Hence it still tasted good they changed the highlight of the teriyaki chicken: they now using white meat without skin so the great crispiness is gone. I was informed that this was done based on customer complains. It seams that people are worried intus to fat with skin on. Well through the process of grilling like these guys somit most of the fat will be gone. I have to say to the owner now you have another type of customer complaining and that's me. Bring back the taste that a chicken pieces with skin bring on the plate  or at least give the customer a Choice!
But again I got an outstanding service from Pak, but I hope the owners reconsider to bring this specialty back! Stay to your first ideas! That will bring the five star back!
***
Well sometime it just take time. As with this place. I have run across this restaurant, well I can not tell how often. Fro
 The outside it looks so upscale that you don't wanna get in for a quick lunch and when you have been looking for dinner it didn't came in mind. 

But now that I'm more around the Castro when I do some volunteering for the SFAF/Struts it just jumped into my face. And since today they advertised my favorite "standard" meal as a special for lunch, I thought I will give it a try. 

And I am happy I did. 

The service is good and fast. I had Pak as waiter, got my order really quick taken off. But my first question, as with each Asian restaurant was of they do MSG, they don't! Which is great, since a real chef should know how to make food tasty without that "help". 

The water is infused with citrus fruit which gives it a real good taste, and not the typical chloride water that you are used to in San Francisco or other big cities. 

But let's talk about the food. Upfront you get the typical Miso soup, but this time I almost finished it - it was very good, and the small green salad had an yummy dressing. Up to a good start, when it comes to the main: It came in a decent size for a lunch. The rice was cooked perfect and was ideal for the use of chopsticks. As garnish there have been cold (?) Brokkoli strains. Well, I could live without them, or just wish they would been heated up. The chicken itself was the real surprise, I love my chicken with crispy skin (well I think it's a german thing) and to provide chicken teriyaki with crispy pieces - you need to know how you tread a chicken. Well they do here, the teriyaki sauce itself was good nothing outstanding, but definitely Had sauces that have been not as good. The sauce was also not to overpowering. The whole combination was just right, a good amount of sesame (always not enough for me) on top has made this a really good chicken teriyaki. 

I learned that the place had a change of ownership recently (four month so in September 17), when I read the old review, it seems as iwas a necessary change. 

So guys keep up the good work, I will check in the future if the crispy chicken was a one time achievement, or if this is the general quality (which I hope).
author: Martin W.

description:
I came back after hearing that Wasabi Bistro was under new management, and I can honestly say I was happily surprised. 

Our waiter came to offer us drinks and menus right away. My concern with the previous iteration of Wasabi Bistro was the lack of (believe it or not) real fish. Previously, everything was a roll smothered in mayo. I was so happy to see that I could actually order both sashimi and nigiri. Since it was before 6:30PM, it was Happy Hour, and I ordered 2 of the Chef Specials, which was about 10 pieces of sashimi for $14, a pretty great deal! 

The quick service and good sushi means I will no longer be avoiding this place. I look forward to trying it again.
author: Bryan M.

description: We recently moved back to the city and decided to give Wasabi Bistro another shot since they are under new management now. Came for lunch and had curry katsu + sashimi. The food came prompty and was pretty good for the price. The service was attentive. Our tea and water were refilled often. Excited to be having a go-to Japanese place in the area again, will be returning more often!
author: Elisa L.

description: Enjoyed the sushi rolls and my family love all the foods we ordered. The staffs were very friendly and helpful!
author: Winnie T.

description:
After a few birthday drinks in the Castro, a friend and I decided to go get something to eat. We always visit another sushi restaurant up the street as it's closer to Market...until we discovered this place. 

I had no idea this place existed and what's better...they have happy hour! The staff was overall friendly but not a huge stand out. I love that they offer happy hour daily from 11:30am-6:30pm. Lots of options and light bites. They have temakis (hand rolls) for $2.95, rolls for $4.95 and an array of appetizers, not to mention beer, wine and sake for a discounted price. For my meal, here's what I got: 

-Chef choice sashimi (5 pcs) for $7.95. For my bowl, I got 3 sake and 2 ahi sashimi pcs. Thick slices, fresh flavor, overall a win!

-Temaki trios of salmon skin, salmon and hamachi, for $2.95 each. The rolls came with cucumber and some scallions, lots of protein, TOTALLY worth the price tag. 

-Miso Salmon Collar for $6.95. For the price, you get a gigantic piece of kama. Flavor town with the miso, another great value!

Overall, a GREAT option in the Castro. Now that I found this place, I will be coming back time and time again. It's convenient and offers some really great options. Come check them out.
author: Rockne H.

description:
Wasabi is easily the best sushi in the Castro and among the best in San Fransisco.  The food is great but the staff is even better.  Everytime I'm here I make sure to sit in Serena's section as she will give you an experience you'll never forget.  Seriously, she is like no one you've ever met or been served by.

Favorites are the hand rolls, Castro rolls, and the Hanna aka which is a special type of sparkling sake.  It's been described as the champagne of the east or some kind of alcoholic Sprite, take your pick.

All in all, wasabi is one of Castro's best.
author: Chris M.

description:
Gave this place another try and came here for happy hour yesterday. The wait staff is just terrible. We had to ask three times for the bill. Their food is fine, nothing bad and nothing great. We had gyoza, calamari, rolls, and fried tofu. I would not recommend coming here.

When the bill came, we tried to do 4 cards. They said 2 card maximum which is against California law. The business is cheap af if they can't ring up multiple cards. Don't bother coming here.
author: William V.

description:
This is one of my favorite  places where you're always can have fresh fish and comfortable environment. it's so good that I need to honestly write a 5 stars review for them.

This place that able to sits around 40 people if it's full packs a punch. That means really good for a big party. And you won't feel very crowded at some points 

We had the Chef's Special "Toro" and "Muki Scallops " and it was very tasty, we gobbled it up fast. The deep fired Calamari also went quickly, very tender and flavorful too.  Their Rainbow Roll creation was so good and match with the crab meat. But the most impressive dish was their Toro Tartare , which took extra time to prepare but was totally worth it, out of this world flavor when paired with the Shrimp Chip dipping with avocado. 

Our regret was that they had sold out of their spicy wings.  Must have been hella popular. Will come back for sure.

Service was friendly and attentive.  Highly recommended.
author: UhWang T.

description: This is a reliably excellent sushi restaurant and I feel lucky to have them just up the street from my house. We have gotten takeout  from them many, many times over the years and the fish is perfectly fresh every time. The salmon tuna tartare is to die for.
author: Jordan J.

description: Ordered Toro tartare (i wanted salmon and spicy tuna one I saw on yelp pics but they were out) and it was AMAZING. The Tuna was extremely fresh and I was hesitant with the white chips but holy moly. I added a line of sriracha on each cup filled tartare and it was perfection. Will come again!
author: Roxie R.

description:
Wasabi bistro will be my new favorite Japanese restaurant in San Francisco.
Looks fancy and upscale and the prices are very responsible. whole  Muki scallop only for $8. And the otoro only for $8 per piece. 
My family had the otoro which was very good and we love it.
Service was on point and the fish was fresh and satisfy our sushi craving! Love it!
author: Rocky L.

description:
This is a nice find in the Castro district. Came here with a group of friends on Wednesday night looking for some Asian fusion / sashimi and sushi to chow down and this place popped up on Yelp, so we gave it a try.

First of all, we were welcomed by most of the staff! Wow! We later found out that there has been a recent change of hands in management. New sushi chef, new manager, new atmosphere!

The decor was pretty clean and modern feel. A very upscale trendy look... If you know what I mean. Due to us being a large group, we were seated at the large table, so I can't comment on the sushi bar experience this time around. The seatings were nice and cozy.

On to the food: they have dozen of appealing selection to choose from and many recommendation from the chef. Since we were crazing for sushi and sashimi, we ordered a few large party trays. The chef also recommended a few dishes for us. The fishes were fresh, high quality cut, and delicious! Definitely some of the best I had in the Bay. You know how they put the leftover heads and tails of the fish as display? Well, the chef came over to our table and offer to make some nice warm fish soup from it!! Now that's customer service! The soup was a nice addition for our after meal. For the other dishes (cooked food), we had tempura, sushi rolls, fried shrimp, and many more that I can't recall. Everything was just amazing. (See my photos).

Overall: if you're in the area and looking for some Japanese fusion food, you should definitely give this place a try! The old management has been replaced a couple of weeks ago... So many of the reviews doesn't really apply anymore. The food and ambient is good for groups or couples! We will be back again soon!
author: Gordon L.

description: I've been here a couple times and the service alone were consistently professional, the food were are ok just don't ever order Ramen as I guess it isn't this place's strong area, though I had the chance to try the Snow Crab Temaki which I thought it is quite impressive.
author: Skyler Z.

description:
This favorite place has recently changed ownership, and sushi bar staff, but the servers and kitchen staff are pretty much the same. I stayed away for a bit, but finally texted Jesse (one of chefs who left, and he said sure, go eat there. 

The menu is a bit smaller and the prices a tad lower, which is a good thing, but the quality of the fish remains good. The new sushi chef Charles is skilled and personable. His sauces and his interpretation of menu items are different but still good. And if you want customization or different things, just ask and he will do it. 
The sake list is different, but they still have my favorite and some good new offerings at reasonable prices. 

It is clearly not Ebisu, or other traditional Japanese sushi place. But being Chinese owned it is warm and inventive and fun loving. Given the other places in this sushi saturated neighborhood, this remains my go-to place for fun, friendliness, affordability and consistent quality. Everything from the bar has been great, I will comment further on the kitchen later, but so far that has also been good.
author: Dennis W.

description: Love all the sashimi and sushi here! Really fresh and juicy! Especially the O toro my favorite! Nice atmosphere and service!
author: Wing W.

description: Something is missing with this place...oh, it's the lack of energy, and lack of flavor in the food. The decor is dark with black banquets, making it like being in a large empty bar... Our server had a frown on his face the entire time, and absolutely no personality whatsoever. Food was not 'bad', just flat and boring... There are far too many other places with enjoyable and welcoming atmosphere, and good food.
author: Greg S.

description:
Truly enjoyed my dining experience at Wasabi Bistro! I came with a large party and the servers were attentive and made sure that we were taken care of.

Salmon sashimi is my absolute favorite and this place has it fresh and oishii. Additionally, I also enjoyed the sushito peppers, seared fish, lamb chop skewers, toro, and chicken karaage. 

It was such a wonderful dinner that I found myself thinking about it the next day and wished that I could eat the meal all over again. Good thing my wish isn't unattainable and I can pay Wasabi Bistro another visit.

wasabi bistro
cozy place for a nice meal
party in your mouth
~haiku
author: Julia L.

description:
This is my FAVE gayborhood sushi spot! Delicious fishes, always quick and friendly service, and excellent house sake. Get there early for the fatty tuna, it sells out quickly and it's my fave! A visitor's guide to the staff:
Eric is shadorable, Serena is the fiercest, and Pak is the sweetness. 
Obviously I'm here at least once a week, can't stop wont stop!
author: Action M.

description:
My boyfriend and I went here for dinner because it was close to his apartment and we were craving sushi. We've walked past it so often but have never tried it, so we decided to give it a chance the other day. 

The restaurant wasn't crowded which was a plus because it was Saturday night around the Castro, which is usually packed. It was super loud inside...that's the only downside. It wasn't crowded at all yet I had to shout to talk. It was a little unnerving.

I ordered the chirashi, and he ordered the chicken katsu curry udon. The chirashi was average...closer to mediocre. The giant chunks of fish were super fibrous and hard to bite. It was also not super fresh. The two pieces of salmon I got were very different - one was super cold (almost frozen?), and the other was super fibrous. I struggled to finish the bowl. The curry udon was okay, I'd say better than the sushi but noodles and curry are hard to mess up. The noodles were a little too soft.

I can't speak for the rolls, but the fish I had was not very good. The sushi rice was the only redeeming part of the order for me. 

I don't think I will come back here since there's so many other better sushi places in the vicinity and San Francisco in general.
author: Steph V.

description: Great happy hour specials as well as long! Last most of the day and you can get sake, beer and some sushi for really good price. The food wasn't the best but it definitely had value for what I paid for. The only complaint I had was that the oysters came out last after all of our other food.
author: Navdeep D.

description:
To be honest, I waffled a little bit on whether this should be a one star review or two. I ultimately decided that nothing was particularly egregiously wrong so probably merited above a one star.

Oh where to begin on this? The lackluster drink? The mildly sketchy oyster? The not so attentive service? Or the acceptable [sic] sushi? I guess starting with the flow of events makes the most sense.

My friend and I ordered a mojito each. It came out in a tumbler glass with a little stirring straw that didn't event make it past the rim of the glass. My glass had white wash streaks around the edge in places and looked less than clean. The drink itself tasted like a lemon/lime soda drink that had gone super flat. Recognizing that this was made with Soju didn't really account for the fact that the flavor was so... odd. And amount of alcohol was a little suspect.

We also ordered the oysters because, when in a coastal area, that's what you do! Unfortunately, with the way the drinks came out the oysters also felt a little suspect. When they came out they were very much no-frills, which is/can be fine. But, the oysters didn't really taste like they had properly been kept frozen. They were not necessarily properly shucked, so the meat slides right off, and personally I felt like the oysters were just a little less than fresh taste wise.

The garlic edamame app we also got was fine. The garlic taste feels like an after though thrown on to the general edamame dish but whatever.

The sushi itself was acceptable. The menu had a lot of frill-ful options but a lot of the base was tuna. Can't say I loved the sushi, can't say I hated it. It was just that, regular sushi.

The service was slow and took us a while to get our checks. We were never asked if we wanted more drinks. We were never asked if we wanted water. We were told the soda came in a can and yet it arrived at the table in a glass. Just these details ended up making this a not particularly well reviewed establishment.
author: John T.

description: Yelping for a sushi place in the area and found this. This restaurant is definitely a hidden gem, the fishes were so fresh at a jaw dropped price. Wish they have uni for the night. I will definitely come back for Uni and try more dishes. The server was very attentive as well.
author: Cadee W.

description: I've been here several times and usually order the chirashi, which is always delicious! This time however our group couldn't stop ourselves and ordered way too much, but ended up finishing everything anyway. Had two new items: some grilled mussels and something that our server Sarina called "happy ending". It was a crispy finger food with avocado, tobiko, and tuna. Always easy to list this place as one of my favorites!
author: Christopher N.

description:
Normally, the service is good. But tonight it was horrible. It took over an hour to get our order - and the. Part of it was wrong. Then we were told that the owner doesn't ever discount or compensate for poor service so none was given. 
--------------
Update 10/1/17: New ownership. Service has been consistently outstanding. They are very eager to please and the food quality is excellent. Great turn-around guys.
author: Daron J.

description:
Serena was extremely helpful with not only navigating the menu but has also suggested great choices with what to get with friends: 

- Castro roll. 
- hamachi Kama
- chef's sashimi
- Hamachi Temaki
- Spicy Tuna
- Tempura

All of these choices were spot on and very tasty. The sale was potent and a treat to have!

It's a great place to hang and get sushi deep in the Castro.
author: Dave S.

description: Came here for a birthday party. We ordered a omakaze, it was amazing and super fresh. Also, we ordered the muki scallop and Japan Uni. The taste was unforgettable and sweet. I would love to get it next time. Moreover, the service was really fast and nice. We were so happy to had dinner there. At the end, we received Mochi ice cream for free. Wasabi Bistro made my day!!
author: Ying Qi G.

description: The raw fish dishes taste fresh but the chef sashimi was pretty small for its price. The cook dishes on the other hand really disappointed us. The agsdashi tofu had no taste whatsoever even after dipping into the sauce for ever. Chicken Karagate is just small popcorn style white meat, flavors less. And the Hamachi collar is over cooked with little flavor. I would recommend only ordering raw dishes here.
author: Eve H.

description: Happy hour is about 8hrs long. How could you go wrong? Oysters are really good and rarely shucked with chips. My favorite things to order are 12 oysters, hamachi roll, or crunchy unagi roll and finish the meal of with a couple pieces of o toro! It's fire and melts in your mouth upon entry. Didn't think castro district would have such a nice sushi place and again happy hour for 8hrs? I work right by this place and love coming with coworkers
author: Tofu S.

description:
I love coming here, everytime I do the service and food are amazing!  Sara is an asset to the team and always makes it a great experience for us. 

The Castro roll, snow crab hand roll and of course the crazy roll with hamachi on top is mouth watering. We'll be back soon!
author: LeNiece V.

description: This place is awesome. Always fresh fish and the rice is the best in the city. Staff is usually very nice as well. The price point of this place makes it easily the best sushi in SF.
author: Jesse M.

description:
We came in on a Thursday night and was warmly greeted by our server, Pak. He was extremely attentive and friendly during our visit. Also, he made great recommendations and I thoroughly enjoyed the dishes!

Let me just say the salmon sashimi is TO DIE FOR. It melts like butter in your mouth! The same could be said about their toro nigiri as well. Currently drooling as I recount the silky, smooth texture of the fish. Bottom line is that their seafood is incredibly fresh! 

I am so happy I found this great little nook in the Castro and will definitely be returning for more!
author: Julisa L.

description:
Absolutely love this place! 

Our friendly server Eric always makes our experience pleasant and tells us about all the current specials. Living in the neighborhood, this has become a favorite go to spot for sushi! My favorite rolls are the the X roll and the double hamachi! We also get the oysters which have always been delightfully fresh!
author: Scott Y.

description: Just came by wasabi they were super busy tonight but me and my boyfriend was seated pretty fast like a 5 minute wait we got the omakaze sashimi the fish was soo fresh it include Toro and some other speacial fish I don't really remember , the service was very accommodating even thought I could tell they were all busy I would come back again seems like a good spot to get a few drinks before going out
author: Jenninie C.

description: Awesome place. Absolute best sushi in the Castro area. The sashimi was really fresh and yummy. Love the O taro very much. New Ownership. Definitely recommend this place to my friends.
author: Jenny H.

description: This is my first time here in Wasabi Bistro and that i am not regret to spend my whole night here. when i came the greeting and the service are excellent. but the point is the Sashimi here are fresh and taste better than other. i will definitely come back again
author: Gary C.

description: Highly recommended for sushi and sashimi lover, the fish here was unexpectedly fresh and high quality for how much they cost. Such as a great place to hangout and dinner with friends or family.
author: Man L.

description: Thoroughly enjoyed our dinner here. They have a really great variety of fish and its very reasonably priced. Was pretty happy to see that they're one of the only places that still allows people to sake bomb - I will definitely be coming back to take them up on this policy. We got a bunch of rolls, fatty tuna, mackerel and a bottle of sake and other than how slow the staff was, it was a great experience!
author: Quinn Li O.

description: The best experience in SF so far! Last year I had very bad experience here but after reading my review, the new manager sent me message and explain led they change the owner and under the new management! He invited me come back to try, I did today. I have to say the perfect food and service this time, very happy with this and will come back for sure! Thank you Pak Cheung!!!
author: Momoko S.

description: Freshest sashimi with a reasonable price. Their Japanese sea urchin is the best I have ever had.  This place consistently good every time I come. I love coming here.
author: Simon W.

description: I have been here tonight with friends for dinner, I love the sashimi and it was so so so amazing. The food I ate were so good, I will be back next time with my families.
author: KeNny L.

description: This sushi restaurant is conventionally located near my apartment and I had walked by it several times so I decided to drop in for lunch today. The space is large but was relatively empty, so I was seated right away. My friend and I shared the baked chicken wings, the steak teriyaki, and a roll. Both the chicken wings and steak were on lunch special so they came with a miso soup and house salad. Miso soup was fine, not much to be said there. The salad dressing was very thick and had a strong mayonnaise taste to it. Our entrees came out soon after. The order of baked chicken wings were very slimy and had an interesting texture to them, while also lacking flavor. Our order of steak teriyaki was mediocre at best, but was riddled with so much extra fat on the meat. The roll was a toss up, I didn't enjoy it but my friend had a better taste for it. Service was fast and the place was clean. I should have followed my instinct and headed to Osaka a block over. All I'm left with is a stomach ache and a $40 hole in my pocket.
author: Miguel R.

description: I ordered a 7pcs omakase. It was so fresh and delious. I really like the toro which is fatty tuna. The service was great and the atmosphere is excellent. Will try it again soon.
author: Ken W.

description: went on a last night with my two friends was served by pak and Eric they were really nice. they introduced  some specials for us which was muki scallop and Toro. My friends and I  tried it and it was so good and fresh. Also they have  very good japan uni. definitely will come back soon.
author: Echo X.

description: Awesome spot located in the festive Castro area. Besties took me here for my bday. Chic and romantic decor. Very clean and tidy, it's important in Jap restaurants. Great owners greet you when you walk in, very personable and friendly. Food is great (curry rice, fish udon soup were soooo good, esp since I am not the biggest fan of curry)!! Sashimi and oysters are fresh. Ikura....ahhhh! We cleared out their uni and fatty tuna. Yuuum!
author: Vee V.

description: I went to this place couple of time and it never let me down. The server is very nice and friendly. The price is very reasonable too. So, it definitely worth to bring friends there. Sushi Omakase $42.95. Also, the muki scallops was so delicious. It definitely worth five stars!! And I love the hef"s special Roll too
author: Serena H.

description: This place was a recommendation from our wine tour guide while visiting San Francisco. It was a short walk from our Airbnb so we gave it a try. The restaurant was a little out-dated and almost empty inside, only 2 others dining in at 8pm, so we were seated right away. The food was good and we enjoyed a quiet night dining. The host/server was very polite and helped us with recommendations where to get the best dessert.
author: Michael W.

description:
Lily Holbrook took me here a few times. This is the restaurant that Lily had treated me at. If San Francisco was to make this restaurant famous because Lily and I ate here then we would be eating here a lot...especially me.

I like this restaurant. I can not resist sushi. The Castro District score a great restaurant. Now I know where to eat at whenever I am around.
author: Ronald N.

description: This is my favorite sushi in San Francisco. I come here time and time again and am impressed. The service is prompt and professional, the decor is nice, and the food is delicious and fresh. It is also more affordable than most places in my opinion. Their appetizers and grill items are so tasty.Their sushi consistently tastes fresh and flavorful. My personal favorite is the rainbow roll. Do yourself a favor and pay Wasabi Bistro a visit!
author: Teddi T.

description: Went back and learned that this place was under new management! Awesome happy hour, nice servers, and overall great experience.
author: Nam-Chi V.

description:
4 stars for that happy hour menu (11:30a-6:30p)! Prices are great for the variety, quality, and presentation of food.

Of the happy hour menu, the rolls tasted fresh, however the seaweed that is used can be stale and chewy. Aside from that, no other problems with the rolls. We tried the asparagus beef, chicken karaage, & the shrimp & veggie tempura - all were very tasty! 

Our 49er roll (not on the happy hour menu) was absolutely delicious as well. I would definitely order that again too. I would love to be back if I'm in the area and craving for some Japanese food!
author: Kris C.

description:
I felt like I walked into Alexis Carrington's living room (circa 1985) with all the swanky chandeliers dripping lighted beads from the ceiling above.  The sylish decor offered a hint of fabulous 80's yesteryear...

Service was great but the restaurant itself wasn't crowded at all when we walked in around 7pm.  That's not a very good sign on a Friday night in the Castro. We didn't have to wait for anyone to approach our table--actually two people came to the table to take our orders within the first 2 minutes.  By the time we left, it was 3/4 full which made me feel  a bit better.

The presentation of food was fine, it's just the fact that in my opinion everything tasted a bit bland.  The miso soup was the best part of the dinner.

 Chicken teriyaki served with soup and salad are as standard as you can get in a Japanese restaurant.  The California Roll that we added is just as standard but it too lacked any kind of pizzazz.  Even the wasabi lacked any bite.

The food looked good but three stars is a fair assessment.
author: Thomas D.

description: My cousins and I flew out to San Francisco to meet up with my brother and his girlfriend for my birthday. On a whim we looked up places nearby that was serving sushi. The menu looked appealing so we uber'ed to Wasabi Bistro. The place exceeded our expectations! We were greeted so kindly from one of the workers. We thought he was a host seating us but as it turns out he was our server. He introduced himself as Eric and he was just so kind & genuine. We really wanted some amaebi but they didn't have any. His guidance and knowledge of the menu helped us pick great choices. We enjoyed the fresh oysters. They were so tasty! The garlic edamame was soooo good! We never had seasoned edamame like that before. It really kicks up the boring typical salted edamame. The rolls were tasty and the sashimi was so good! It melted in our mouths. Eric helped us pick out bottles of cold sake to celebrate my birthday. I definitely recommend the Yuki Nigori Lychee sake and the Sho Chiku Bai Nigori Saka. And to top it off, Eric surprised our table with a birthday dessert for me consisting of different flavors of mochi ice cream!! I love mochi! Everyone in my party was so pleased with the food and definitely the service! 5 stars for Eric and Wasabi Bistro! I definitely recommend you check it out!!
author: Josie S.

description:
I'm currently having dinner here on a Sunday evening with a friend, and I have to say this is THE WORST restaurant service I've ever had in my life. Their food was just average, and the service was absolutely terrifying. I don't normally leave reviews on Yelp but, wow, here it is. 

The restaurant was not all that busy, not even half full, and we had to wait about 40-45 minutes for our food to come out. When our miso soup finally came out they forgot to bring us spoons, so we had to wait about 10 more minutes to even begin to start having some food in our stomach. No refills on our water at all and 2 waitresses we're just too busy chatting with the regulars. 

We finally got a chance to ask for our check and the girl with the ponytail just dropped the receipt on our table and walked away. 

We were both polite through out the visit, but the service was so disgusting that food I just had is about to come out. I don't think I would ever come back to this restaurant ever, but if I do I'll make sure I have at least an hour to sit around waiting for food to come out.
author: Nathan L.

description:
Food is great, prices are great, sushi bar is great. I even like the music choices. 
My only issue is the service, it's just very inconsistent. Sometimes it's stellar, sometimes it's flat out bad. 

Ill still give 5 stars hoping for future improvements with the staff.
author: Jakub P.

description: My husband and I go here (or get delivery) every month, and it never disappoints. Quality fish, consistent flavor and presentation, and reliable service in the restaurant. One star taken off for somewhat unreliable delivery; on occasion, they've closed early, and our delivery orders simply haven't been filled. Call ahead to make sure they're open before ordering!
author: Charlotte H.

description: Came here to celebrate my friends birthday. It was a really great experience. We love their happy hour menu. Shigoku oyster only $2 each. And we ordered a lot of beer and hot sake which are very reasonable price. But sometime they are short of server.
author: Ning L.

description: Found this restaurant on yelp!!! Very good quality with decent price!!! They have happy hour till 630pm. I came in for lunch and ordered the beef teriyaki!!! Tasted delicious !Definitely bring my friends next time !!
author: Cui Larm C.

description:
Today my friend and I came in amidst the chaos of SF pride, but despite just how busy it was with people in and out of there, they managed to get us seated and our food quickly, and Eric was very attentive to our needs.
 First off, the food is fantastic! Solid rolls, reasonable pricing, and great combination of flavors & food options available. But the quality customer service drives it all home. Will definitely come back again. Thanks for the great dinner experience!
author: CJ D.

description:
Great Happy Hour options, from food to drinks. 
The prices are competitive for sushi in the area. The environment is clean and trendy. 
I do frequent this location for lunch. It's never typically super busy and they get by with having 1-2 waiters. If you do happen to be in when they are busy, you probably will get slower service. I try not to be too harsh because I've also been there when the service was amazing. 
My one complaint: I always have to ask for a straw with my water and that seems to be difficult to get at times. I feel bad asking the waiter to walk all the way back to the kitchen and back to my seat just for a straw. They should carry some in aprons.
author: Chris S.

description: This is a very good Japanese restaurant. The waiters are friendly. The second roll is special order from the chief. Must try
author: Ya Ling L.

description: Serena was our waiter tonight. She was friendly and attentive. The food was amazing and delicious! I recommend this place if you want great sushi in the Castro.
author: Kao S.

description: I LOVE this place!!  Their lunch menu has options from the sushi bar (6pc rolls and small hand rolls) for really great prices.  For example, I can order a roll and have sake for $11!!!! And the sushi is FRESH. Ive had several things off the menu, a variety of sushi, tempura, salads, and all of it was really tasty. I'm telling you, I'm hard to please, and wasabi bistro does not disappoint.  Great atomsphere (my coworker takes his husband there for date night) with top of the line service. Shout out to Louis!!!! You guys keep me coming back again and again.
author: Meagan M.

description: They use real crab in their rolls, the sashimi is fresh, and prices are reasonable. It's one of my go to places in the Castro.
author: Jim B.

description: The best Japanese food I've everrrr had.. the portions were great, the fish and vegetables were fresh. But most of all the service from Serena was beyond amazing,  great personality, and made our experience fun. I will defiantly come back and recommend this place to friends that visit the castro.
author: Izzy S.

description: This place is a gem. If you get the opportunity to stop by during happy hour, I highly recommend trying the place out. The service is friendly enough and the food is great for its price point.
author: Monica R.

description: Great Happy Hour value with quick and friendly service. We stop here once a week after school because my daughter likes their maki and california rolls. Nice oysters with the yuzu mignonette.
author: Chi C.

description: Wasabi is my favorite spot in the castro. Service is great and food is hella good. :)
author: Aaron K.

description: Good sushi. Good service. Overall reasonable prices for decent sushi. Just nothing incredible.
author: Alex G.

description:
Wasabi Bistro is my new place to get happy hour priced oysters!

That was actually the only reason why I came here. I ordered a philly roll (cream cheese with salmon) and half a dozen of oysters. At first, I was skeptical because whenever it's happy hour oysters, they're usually really small. However, I was surprised when they came out because their oysters here were huge!

Not only that, but we also tried their hot sake. Honestly, it was my first time trying them and it felt like taking shots of hot vodka...

I'd love to come back here and I can't wait to get more oysters!
author: Aj C.

description: My friend recommended me to check this restaurant out. and it was very good recommendation. I order 16pcs omakaze sushi. The sushi was so fresh and delious. I love their Toro (fatty tuna) and Muki Scallop nigirl.  I will definitely be back soon.
author: ANsome Z.

description:
Pros
-Food is fairy well and tastes good. 
-music playlist is an awesome mix of EDM and house and not too loud. 

Cons
-Service is TERRIBLE.

I came on Saturday at around 1-2pm ish. The server seated us, and then completely forgot about us. We waited 25 minutes before he came back to take our order. He only realized he forgot us after looking at the computer. When our food came, we were served the wrong thing. We ordered Katsu but received Chicken Teriyaki instead. Our server never checked up on us and never offered additional drinks or refills. 

Retrain your servers!!!
author: Chris R.

description: Very friendly sushi chef that created such excellent sashimi dish. Great service with very reasonable price. Definitely will come again next week.
author: Patrick M.

description: This is the place you want to go for quality Japanese Sushi. Everything was extremely fresh! Our favorite was definitely the scallops, uni, clean raw oysters, and Sashimi! Speaking of sashimi, the toro tuna (a fatty part of tuna, medium level) is superb! The waiter gave us a bottle of sake to thank us for patronage.
author: William L.

description:
A good restaurant to bring out if town guests to if you want a quick bite or a snack. For a nice sit down meal though...id go elsewhere.  

Japanese restaurants these days are all over so it takes something special to stand out. This place has a happy hour with dollar oysters and some reasonably priced (but generic) rolls. It's also in a fun part of town. 

On the downside, Slurp is a few businesses down while Anchor Oyster is across the street. Stiff competition...

Very nice atmosphere and a nice staff.
author: Joshua F.

description: Some of the best sushi I have ever had. Fresh, succulent, friendly service, and extremely affordable! My fiance and I ordered sake, wine, and a few rolls of sushi. Happy hours are great here. Ginger is hella fresh, quite possibly the best ginger I have had. I am surprised this doesn' have better reviews. Regardless, please give Wasabi Bistro a try, you won't regret it.
author: Nima B.

description:
I always come before going to work here, because it not only have the best happy hour prices , but the environment is peaceful and the food is 5stars quality .  

I have to re review because of my server : Serena . Am sorry . First she brings me the wrong beer , then a wakami salad which I did not order then I order 2 rolls and a golden tape the tuna was really old and o ask her to sent it back. Yet she still put it on the bill. I was expecting to remove it from the bill but it didn't happened.
author: Simon B.

description:
My friend brought me to this place for the first time after working out and the portobello mushroom tempura is everything! I'll come back just for that,and the sushi was delish too!
Our server, Serina is the (sake) bomb!
author: Gonzy Z.

description:
Sexy, shiny lounge like decor..think Carbon Lounge on Bay Street sorta.  We were too late for happy hour but we picked Wasabi Bistro due to location, and the good reviews.  Also, because my friend wanted ramen, and I wanted some sushi or other non-noodle options.  

We shared the veggie gyoza.  He got the chicken miso ramen and I got the Castro Roll..well..when in Castro right?!  The Castro roll was spicy crab, avocado, cucumber, jalapeno and Suzuki (waiter described it to me as like a butterfish) and a special spicy sauce.  Veggie gyoza was nice and crisp but not greasy filled with delightful veggies.  My Castro roll was huge and yes indeed, spicy!  The seafood was fresh and it was a great roll.  However, after I ate a few pieces, I noticed a hair ontop of one of the pieces..ugh..and I don't think it was mine.  But this happens at so many restaurants so I won't hold them too accountable for it.  He enjoyed his huge bowl of ramen.  I like how Wasabi Bistro offers a lot of alternatives for SF's diverse clientele - veggie options, soy paper options for sushi, etc. 

Service was friendly and good, but then as they got busier a little less attentive.  Prices are a little on the higher side.  I would give them somewhere between a 3.25 - 3.5.  I would be game for coming again for some more rolls and drinks if I needed to meet up with him in the Castro area again.
author: Cat C.

description: Had the chicken udon bowl, it was ok, lacked some flavor and not big on japanese noodles.  Service was mediocre at best.  Overall nice establishment though, ambience was very nice.
author: Jacob D.

description:
The waiter we had was very nice! He reminded me of the kpop singer name Jay Park. His service actually made the experience a lot better. He was nice that he apologized for my roll taking long, complimented my makeup and how he liked how white my teeth was all through out the day. The temperature of the restaurant was alittle humid for me. The appearance of the place was very classy and beautiful. One con about the restaurant is that their toilets are not the best at flushing! Haha, I attempted to flush 4 times because the toilet seat cover wouldn't go down. 
 
The prices here are the same price as any other sushi restaurants. The highest roll is around $12 and the Sashimi is around $16. The rolls were not the best sushi we tasted. The sushi is quite mediocre and the presentation of it was unevenly cut. I got the Crunch Unagi Roll which took a bit to be served. I was fine because it had to be deep fried which as long as there's reason then I'm fine. The other rolls which tasted very basic were the Tempura roll & Spicy Tuna roll. 

The restaurant's sushi is good for just a quick lunch break. If you're looking for a very flavorful tasting sushi or something that stands out, this may not be the best fit. Overall it was a decent experience.
author: Kathleen M.

description: Great place to relax and eat. Came with family and noticed a very nice ambiance. Service was really friendly and nice. Only one sushi chef working a busy night, props to him. The sashimi was very fresh and thickly cut. The salmon melts in my mouth and everything paired nicely with a bottle of sake.
author: Liana L.

description: If you're going to randomly take out happy hour, you should let your staff and costumers know first.
author: Jasmine P.

description:
I was referred here by a friend. This is the Best place for sushi!!!! everything is so good!!!!!  Service was great!!!!  Food was delicious! I will definitely come back again with more friends. 

Ask about the secret menu!
author: The T.

description:
This is one of my favorite Japanese restaurant in the Bay Area!!!! Chef Jesse is the best, he is incredibly creative with Japanese fusion food. Their sashimi and sushi are always fresh and tasty! He always surprise us with new ideas with fresh ingredients. And I love their desserts too. 

Great food, great people and great service! Highly recommended！
author: Harmony Y.

description: Came here for happy hour last week and had a mediocre experience.  Sushi was ok although the service was bad.  5 tables with 9 people total including us.  2 servers and 3 sushi chefs.  It took 43 mins to get 2 rolls- spicy tuna and hamachi. No one checked on us or offered a refill of drinks. They seemed to be more focused on the to go orders than actual people waiting to order.  We chose to go elsewhere after the 43 min wait.
author: Kyle H.

description: This place was BOMB. Great food. Great service. The sushi options were unique, and great tasting. Serena was a phenomenal waitress who had great knowledge of the menu and tastes and even hooked us up with some sake. The ingredients were fresh and savory. I intend to return and enjoy their delicious sushi offerings again in the future. If you like bomb ass sushi, come party at wasabi bistro
author: Sam C.

description: Came here with the family and we really enjoyed ourselves.  The food and the service was excellent.  The staff was friendly and attentive to our needs.  Will definitely come back whenever we are in the area.
author: Kenno K.

description: Horrible service, order was wrong, etc. All the typical "one star" reasons apply here. Icing on the cake- when I checked my bank account a few days later & saw that the server changed the amount. She thought she deserved more than I left I guess.... oh and she did the exact same thing to my friend I was dining with. The manager I spoke with was completely unconcerned that the EMPLOYEES ARE COMMITTING CREDIT CARD FRAUD. That server still works there so make sure you pay with cash!
author: S A.

description: I went to this place yesterday around 7, it was not busy and we got a table as soon as we arrived and served with water immediately. Their water very tasty because they use all kinds of fruit. The waitress was very kind, and helpful. We tired their Ameabi nigiri on the chef's special. It was AMAZING. It tastes like lobster, I would recommend you to try it and I will definitely come back.
author: Ronak K.

description: Wasabi Bistro is a very good place to dine in Castro District. The interior of the restaurant looks elegant. The price of the food is acceptable and the quality is awesome. Even more, the waiters working there are very nice to serve customers, which gives me good impressions.  I am sure I will try it again in the future because of its fantastic experience.
author: Kings Z.

description: I just had dinner... I know the waitress for so long and she's amazing. Tonight, I experienced something very upsetting. I saw the main bartender slapped the waitress. I am not sure why but you don't go to violence.  He should be fired for sure... the worse thing is that no one complained. including people eating there! why! they just stayed quiet like nothing happen.  Disgusting... shame of you! Today is 6-6-2017 and this happened around 7:13 pm
author: Said D.

description: This is my favorite "food as art" destination in the city. If you can find better fried shishito peppers in town, let me know and I'll buy you two plates of them. In addition to all the sushi bar standards, they have a huge variety of really creative additions to the menu. Add to that a good sake selection and very thoughtful service, and you have a winner.
author: Rick S.

description: I love the food and service , especially the Santa Barbara uni , good for party to come, the fish the so fresh so good ! Come come come!
author: Kaiya X.

description:
I really want to like this place since I have a couple of friends that love it.  However, after a couple of abysmal experiences, I have to say avoid it.  The food is ok and the happy hour food special is very reasonable.  The problem is the service is terrible.  My first experience here was last June.  We were a group of 8 on a Sunday evening (Pride in fact).  The first hint that we should have avoided the place was that it was empty.  It still took about 20 minutes for a waiter to come over and take our orders, and then another 45 minutes to get food.  

My second poor experience with this place was yesterday around 6pm (a Saturday night).  5 of us ordered a bunch of food to share.  Even though the place was not busy at all, it took forever to get the food.  The worst part was that when we paid, we were short-changed $20.  I personally know all the money was there since I counted it.  Not sure how that happened, but not going back, ever!  Don't waste your money and time.
author: Larry L.

description: I had a early dinner at Wasabi Bistro on Jan 23 2018. They had a special dinner menu. I ordered the salmon teriyaki with a small seaweed salad and miso soup for 7.99. I was served by Serena, very nice competent waitress. The salmon was good size portion with rice and broccoli. Very happy with the freshness and quality of the salmon. They also have a great happy hour drink and sushi menu till 6pm. Been told that Wasabi has been bought with a new owner. Highly recommend Wasabi Bistro for great service and food.
author: David D.

description:
Every time I move to a new city, I start exploring. Gyms. Restaurants. Clubs. Coffee Shops. Bars. Parks. The purpose is clear; to soak in the local flavor and find things that you love about a city; to make it home.

When I moved to Phoenix years ago, I discovered Fez. Then I got to San Diego and it was Hash House a Gogo. Then in Berkeley, it was Lime (okay, in SF). Then in LA, it was Animal.

The category? Mood enhancers. Those places that are so on top of their game, do what they do so well, and make you feel so comfortable, that you just click into place and go "Yup, this is one of those gold-star places."

In 2014, in San Francisco, Wasabi Bistro is the place. I don't even know what to say, other than look at my pictures. The presentation was spot-on, the flavors were flawless, the sushi amongst the freshest I've had. The sake was delightful. The waiters were handsome (Hey, you're looking at a place in the Castro. You care too.) The owner was friendly, knew half of the customers by name, and hugged half of them on their way out the door after their meal.

Chatting with the owner a bit as our party had dinner tonight, somehow he came to feel like a friendly uncle who owns a restaurant. Which is two things... one... really how you want to feel at a place to plan to return to regularly... and two... really weird because there's no resemblance at all... Okay, maybe I should stop taking myself too literally here.

Seriously, worth checking out. I don't know what the few bad reviewers were talking about, but I suspect that either they caught the place while it was still undergoing some settling-in period... they had a few bad apples they no longer have... or something. Because I'm a sushi snob, as well as, you know, a general snob, and this place just nailed it.
author: Sean B.

description:
Two stars, for the following reasons:

1- one member of our party was not served water for maybe ten minutes
2- an older man was slapped violently, twice, by a waiter. This led to a loud drama with the store owner (?) that ultimately failed to reach consensus. A disturbing scene to say the least
3- the four dishes came out in three waves, though the restaurant was almost empty at the time
4- the steak teriyaki had large chunks of fat on it. For a 18$ dish to come seemingly unprepared?
5- the music was generally awful
6- the chicken teriyaki was tough and also unsatisfying 
7- the shrimp tempura made one person begin to feel sick during the largely unfinished meal 
8- the garlic edamame was phenomenal, +1 star 

After bringing up our issues with the food, we received a 10% discount, which we returned naturally as a tip. I'm sure they've had better nights, but the quality of the food left much to be desired. We ate a little over half and refused takeaway.
author: R S.

description:
If I had to pick a sushi/Japanese restaurant in the Castro district, it'd be Wasabi Bistro. 

I pride myself in thinking that I'm somewhat of a sushi connoisseur, and in terms of taste, service, decor and price(not that this place is cheap, because it's definitely not).

Value wise, they have an excellent happy hour menu: $1 oysters, $5 tempura $4 gyozas, a real bang for your buck. Moreover, their happy hour starts at 11:30am, which is unheard of.

I recommend their 3pcs/ or 6pcs Omakase menu in order to enjoy the best and tastiest sushi they offer.

I HIGHLY recommend their seared walu sushi-succulent, tasty, buttery, orgy and heaven in your mouth awesomeness.

As of right now, I'm the "duke" of Osaka sushi, which is a far cry from what Wasabi Bistro is. It's just that the later is right across from my work and I rather not walk further.

I strongly recommend you to try this place. Great food, Assertive service and has a modern touch in its decor.

5 stars!
author: Jan R.

description: Worst service ever. Left after waiting for 15 minutes for a server to take our order.
author: Michael T.

description:
My first experience here was almost 2 years ago, and I remember it being quite good. My friend frequents the restaurant a lot, so I figured it must be good still. Well, the food was good, but I experienced the weirdest service ever. 

Let's start with the food though. I ordered the bacon scallop, which took a while to make but I was glad because it was grilled perfectly and had the natural flavor of the scallop and bacon without any extra sauces. The tuna tataki was not the freshest, and had a super rubbery texture. The teriyaki/soy sauce saved it from being a flavorless, mushy disaster. Finally the veggie tempura was quite nice. Perfectly fried. 

So the next part was really weird. My friend asked for a glass of water, and upon bringing it, the waitress asked if I wanted a glass of water too, so I said ok. She replied "why didn't you tell me earlier so I could bring them at the same time. Now I have to go back and get it. hahaha, just kidding." At first I was going to brush it off, but then it sunk in and I was furious. I'm thinking you asked me, not the other way around, and second I don't even know you. I haven't become a regular customer to have that kind of banter. It was just completely weird and unnecessary.
author: Thomas L.

description: Went for Fri night dinner, not filled to capacity and we got quick service. My phone was out of battery and they offered to charge it at the counter while we ate. We ordered a bottle of sake, chicken udon noodle, chirashi and wasabi-garlic shrimp. All the food and drinks were perfect for the evening! Prices were a bit on the higher side. Ambience is pretty good.
author: Sid W.

description: Fantastic happy hour really great deals.  This place is decent and very approachable sushi place.  No it is not the cutting edge or best sushi in SF, but it is reasonable and tasty.  Wait staff is always super nice and friendly.
author: Mickey D.

description:
Thanks, but no thanks.

Food:  Chirashi was just ok.  Sorta skimpy on the fish.  Some of the fish was not quite as fresh as I would have liked.  The tempura was standard and somewhat unremarkable.  The miso soup was also standard and unremarkable.

Service: Very slow, no fault of the waiter, since he was the only one for the whole restaurant during lunch time.

Ambiance: Quite modern and club-esque.

Overall, I will probably not be returning to this place when there are so many other places to eat in the area.
author: Susan C.

description: I was referred to this place by a friend. ambiance is relaxing and hip. Service was excellent, the waiter  greeted us and seated us right away, the food arrived continuously. FOOD Is delicious! We will definitely be coming back! The owner is friendly and awesome.
author: Jim H.

description: We had the Godzilla roll (delicious), 49er and veggie tempura roll and also the calamari and edamame for appetizers.  Everything was absolutely delicious! This place does not disappoint!
author: Caro L.

description: I have never written a review and have traveled to over 50 countries and currently travel for business all over the US which equates to many meals in restaurants. My husband and I went to Wasabi Bistro last night and had an unbelievable situation. When we first arrived (to an empty restaurant) at 7:45 on a Saturday- the hostess looked at us as though we were bothering her. After being seated -  my husband went to the men's room and I looked at the menu. When he returned, he asked if a noticed a candle smell (which I did) and he said the smell was really bothering his eyes. We decided to leave. Instead of just walking out- I made an effort to tell the hostess we were leaving and explained that the smell was bothering my husbands eyes and that we would come back another time. Well- this hostess went off on me - and actually told me we were rude for coming in to "pretend" we were going to eat there just to use the bathroom. I was floored and calmly tried to explain that wasn't so. My husband came back into the restaurant to see why I didn't walk out with him and I explained what was going on and he asked to speak to the manager. A women came from the kitchen who claimed to be the manager and as we were explaining what happened she abruptly stopped me and said "don't come back here again". Then the hostess called my husband a bitch? Rest assured we will never be back and I will tell everyone I know not to ever eat at Wasabi Bistro. We live in the neighborhood and are very connected to the community. To the owner of this establishment- you have very poor representatives working for you and they may be the reason why your restaurant was empty on a balmy Saturday night. We've eaten at this restaurant many times and will never be back. You seriously could not make this story up. WORST EXPERIENCE EVER.  ZERO STARS!!
author: Deidra G.

description: Wasabi is definitely a place to go on a Saturday night. One of the better spots in Castro to eat, it's a good pregame spot, and the servers are so fun!! Def made my experience at wasabi more enjoyable! S/O to Eric and Serena for the awesome service!! The portobello mushroom tempura is bomb.com btw
author: Brandon I.

description: Never ever again!  They have the big sign of $1 oyster.  After we ordered, the staff came back and said the oysters were out and didn't even offer anything else.  They kept the big sign out there.  Service was horrible, she looks so mad, must had a bad day.
author: Gary W.

description:
How fabulously swanky and perfectly appropriate Wasabi Bistro is for the Castro where everything just needs to be, well, fabulous. At least that's the impression I got when I entered the doors of this new Japanese eatery, the one that took over All Season Sushi. I came at about 8PM on a Wednesday after a rather long day at work, and the place was still moderately busy. I was seated in the bar area where there were plenty of empty two-tops. It should come as no surprise that the decor was dominated by black lacquer, high-end light fixtures and lots of mirrors.

It was like eating at Liberace's Vegas showroom. Like I said...fabulous. Complimentary edamame arrived almost as soon as I sat down (see photo). While I was squeezing the beans into my mouth one pod at at time, I kept noticing how the menu went on for days as it was dominated by quite an eclectic collection of sushi and rolls. I always feel guilty ordering an elaborate sushi plate just for myself, so I went modest and ordered the $6.50 Spicy Tuna Roll (see photo) - simple, risk-averse and to the point. It was just fine as a starter.

The main event came with the $11 bowl of Pork Ramen, which came in a white designer bowl more fitting as part of a Danish modern place setting. The surprise was how delicious it was with slices of rolled roast pork generously swimming in the hearty broth alongside bamboo shoots and bean sprouts (see photo). I had every reason to believe it was going to be a noodle disaster, but far from it, I think I may come back just for that again. I'm also tempted to try tantalizing side dishes like wasabi scallop, tofu steak or any of the robata since I like the challenge of skewers when I eat.

FOOD - 4 stars...killer ramen bowl is a major surprise worth trying here
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...just fabulous...it's the Castro, sweetie
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...on the quiet side
TOTAL - 4 stars...makes me want to try some more
author: Ed U.

description: Thank you for the amazing lunch! Food was tasty, portions were quiet big, and service was great! Definitely come back for that tempura and chicken teriyaki box.
author: Y D.

description: I went to Wasabi Bistro on APRIL 30th and the Sushi chef Albert treated me to the most amazing Sushi I have had in several years. The fish he served was amazingly fresh and his combinations on some of the items was almost like watching an artist doing his best work. It was heaven to enjoy such excellent service, food and all around ambiance.
author: Jose A I.

description:
Looooooove this place. If sushi was a drink, this would be my watering hole.

They have super cheap specials every day from 11:30 - 6:30 EVERY DAY. AAAND they usually have their wifi up. Which means you can come at 3:30 to do work, grab some sushi and chill out, OR you can get here at 6 with a friend, order quickly and escape with a great deal.

I'm usually here for happy hour, but I do come during their full-price fancy time. I also want to be clear that their 'full price' is still very reasonable. It's not the best sushi in the world, but I think it's the best sushi in the Castro.

Things to note:
- The grilled asparagus is DE-LICIOUS
- Pork gyoza = amazing
- Shrimp Tempura role is my personal favorite
- The seared scallops with eggplant is HEAVENLY (try it)
- Dragon rolls are great

Pretty much everything you can order is great. It's clean, tastes great, and the service is attentive and fast. The vibe is chill, casual, kinda loud once people get drinking, but it's also a place you can pull your laptop out at the bar... "Very SF" as it were.

If you live within 4 blocks and haven't been here yet, WAT are you doing with your life?
author: Andrea D.

description: Horrible service and false advertising.  Came for the oysters and happy hour.  Happy hour prices are no different than other times.   After bringing part of order we were told they were out if oysters and tempura peppers we ordered, no apologies.   If we were told upfront we could have found what we craved elsewhere.   The still didn't take down the oysters sign out front.
author: Emerson B.

description:
The veggie sushi is ON. My fav is the dragon roll, no eggplant. 

Four stars. 

The sweet potato and avocado marry each other all up in my roll. Every time.  The roll is finished off with a very dainty lil' sprinkling of sesame seeds. Your mouth will thank you, bow down to you, throw you a party. 

This used to be our go-to spot for sushi delivery. I'll be honest, they suck at getting your order to you in a timely manner. Seriously though, you won't get your order for an hour and a half or two, and they won't even trip on that. They aren't accountable for their poor a** service, and that's what kills me. We have officially broken up.

Not cool, so I gotta give 'em 1 star.
author: Gabriela W.

description: The food is good but when they have a good service. We ordered lunch meal and it came out with COLD CHICKEN. We ordered rolls and it came out without ginger and wasabi... Really!!! No wasabi for sushi roll!!! It took for 10mins to get my wasabi when the rolls almost finished. Honestly the food is my bad... But PLEASE keep you food hot and enough stuffs... Otherwise don't have happy hour when you can't manage
author: Eric R.

description: This weekend was my first time trying sushi in the Castro, and I'm sure I'll be back. I loved how cheap the selections were and the happy hour menu. I paid less than 20 dollars for all the food I got and it was so worth it. The presentation was beautiful and it tasted great.
author: Korra B.

description: I don't understand why it's not five stars? My sashimi was fresh and amazing as well as my oysters.  Great selection of saki.  I would say the service is a bit dysfunctional but nothing horrid.  I had a party of four with numerous rolls and fresh fish.
author: Carl P.

description: Just stopped in for the amazing happy hour! So lucky to have sashimi and California roll made by Jessie . Check this place out!
author: Jason P.

description: My partner LOVES this place so much he had me drive three hours just to come here! The food is amazing and the atmosphere is beautiful! I will offer one piece of advice DONT ask to get your California roll "crunchy" or it'll be a huge problem, so much in fact the server started to get very upset over it and became rude and almost hostile when I asked him why that was. I was confused because I was not asking to substitute anything on the lunch combo I was simply asking him to add the crunchy bits on top of the item already included in the combo! I am surprised how upset he got over such a small thing! Oh well next time I will make sure I don't get him as a server!
author: Kendall D.

description: Yay for $1 Oysters! The oysters were fresh and tasted amazing. Their sauce is pretty good, it was similar to a light soy sauce but a lot better and I loved the onions on top. The waiters were really nice. My only complaint was that it took quite a long time for the oysters to come out even though there wasn't a ton of people at the restaurant.
author: Amanda B.

description:
Decided to come here for my lunch break and made it in time for happy hour 11:30-6:30

Love the ambiance and the sleek look of the bar
My server was Serena and she's pretty amazing!
Customer service was on point, all the staff were friendly
Choice of music was great!

I ordered a tempura for appetizer, calamari, unagi roll with a large sake on the side. No major complaints, will be coming back for a dinner date next time!

Check out this spot if your in the Castro area :)
author: Marjorie B.

description:
Nice food Nice people ...
A vieuw months ago we visit them to 
The dinner was okay ..
Butt the are so much better now!
We Will visit them again
author: Eldert W.

description:
Great service. Fast. Great specialties. Fresh fish. What else can you ask for.

I love their Toro Tartare. Taste so fresh and automatically melts in your mouth.

They also have a special fried rice which absolutely mind blowing. (Mix in some fresh wasabi!)

Also, their Shooter Tasting is to die for. A little bit of everything on each spoon for you to try! What else can you ask for?
author: Darrin L.

description: I wouldn't make a special trip here, but it's fun & high energy spot to grab some pretty good sushi after a few drinks or just before. They have a good happy menu and some bar seating if your sitting alone.
author: Derwood A.

description:
Drove 20 mins to this place per yelp's 4 star rating. Posted on their website and here in yelp that they are open from 11:30-11pm

I came on a thursday at 3:30pm and this guy was telling me they are closed and will open in 30mins?!!! WTH

Was so disappointed because that was day that my son was supposed to get his braces on at 4:30pm and the only thing he wants to eat before he had them on is sushi!

Long story short, we didnt get his sushi, and of course he couldnt eat anything after the braces are on :,( 

I would stick to isobune in burlingame, they have authentic sushi! and great customer service
author: Batchie B.

description: Delicious food! The people are so friendly as well! I come here every time I'm in town. Fresh everything.
author: Krys L.

description: I'll give them credit where it's due, and they've certainly improved the service.  I don't see the terrible servers anymore including the guy that used to do shots at our table getting messy drunk is gone.
author: Sean M.

description: Every single item was fresh and delicious. We went during happy hour and took advantage of some great deals...$4.95 rolls, $2.95 hand rolls, $1 oysters (minimum 6), drink specials, etc. My personal favorites were the spicy unagi hand roll, the scallop roll, and the oysters (5 star/amazing)!
author: Antonio B.

description:
What a horrible place this has become! I could not wait to get out of there.

This was our third  time and each time it got worse. First thing of the evening was that they had no oysters but the advertised $1 oysters happy hour sign was still outside. We were the first table in the restaurant on a Thursday. They should have had oysters. 

They served everything backwards with the appetizers last. I don't get it. 

All the food was tasteless. Cheap grade tuna. Please avoid.
author: Victor P.

description:
didn't know what to expect, but my taste buds and tummy were amazed and sated.. will definitely come back! &thanks for the great service.

your food was a great start to an amazing night!!
author: Bronx H.

description:
I seriously don't understand any of the negative reviews on here. 
Wasabi Bistro is still amazing!!!!

I went in there today and we had the best meal from them yet! They do their happy hour deal even on Saturdays (sidenote: OF COURSE you can't pay happy hour prices for to-go, every one knows that!). $5 rolls, cheaper appetizers (which are all super tasty)

I've only had kind attentive service from this place. The sushi and oysters are fresh and delicious. We really enjoy the calamari appetizer and 1$ oysters during happy hour. 

We left only wishing we could come immediately back and gorge ourselves on more delicious sushi and snacks. This place is NEEDED in our neighborhood. The ambiance is fantastic, the service is friendly and the food is affordable and exceptional.

Always a happy day with Wasabi Bistro in my belly.
author: Jane H.

description:
This review is only base on service and service only . How can a whole restaurant be ruin? By putting the wrong person at front.
 We went there for the happy hour / very late lunch for us. Great selection of rolls and appetizer, the food was delicious, we were happy even though our sever was very spaced out, we had to ask her twice for drinks and call her attention from a distance, but oh well. 
So what happened? 
Our bill was $55 and cents, we left 65 ( 3 bills of 20 and 5 ones) and left, walk to the corner and waitress came running and yelling at us that we were a dollar short and we didn't even tip her, holding our money on her hand like a mad lady, in the middle of the street! Very embarrassing...I ask her wasn't the bill 55? It looks like you have over $60 on your hand. She THEN COUNT THE MONEY, and look at me and say oh I'm so sorry! I didn't count it right......seriously?????? Seriously this is how you treat costumers that actually tip you regardless of your service? This is not how you treat customers, period! I was embarrassed and it ruin the whole experience, I will really like to come back to this place but the service is just unprofessional , how can you not even count your money and do such a scene? 
I called and ask to talk to a manager or owner and there is none, that explains her behavior. Maybe the owners should take care of the business better...... 
Really disappointed....
author: Karen P.

description: What a scam. I went in on my way to an event to grab a couple rolls to go during their happy hour. After waiting 25 minutes I ask to pay because I am already late when another guy tells me happy hour isn't for take out and those rolls aren't on happy hour. I left disgusted. Just stay away. Horrible service.
author: Devlin D.

description:
