Basic. Nothing special, solid location which is why I assume they generate business. Otherwise it's not sushi I would go out of my way to eat nor avoid, it's blah. Personally, if I'm paying sushi prices I would appreciate some tasty unique rolls. 

Not for me.
author: Gabriela F.

description:
It's one of my fav sushi places. And the waiters are hot. Come for the great sushi and the cute waiter boys
.
author: Duy N.

description:
We came in close to closing time and the only downside was having to ask the hostess to sit us after a few minutes of waiting. They were super dead and the food came fairly quickly. Delicious food and good ambiance. Tastefully decorated and great window seats to people watch. 

I would come back for the food alone it was well worth it.
author: David T.

description:
I AM IN TOTAL SHOCK THAT I JUST HAD AN EXPERIENCE LIKE THIS AT A RESTARAUNT. IF YOU WANT TO BE VERBALLY ATTACKED BY A WAITER, PAY WASABI BISTRO A VISIT. 

I came here with my girlfriend and roommate to grab some lunch. The service was a bit slow from the beginning, and after delivering our initial order, we asked for a sake refill from our waitress, who then disappeared from the restaurant for at least 20 minutes. After 15 minutes of waiting, we asked the sushi chef about our sake and received an eye roll and response that "it was coming." 

Once 30 minutes had passed a different waiter who was serving other tables stopped by our table and asked (with an attitude) if we were done . My roommate commented that we were waiting for sake and weren't ready to go, but had waited so long that we just wanted the check now. The waiter then snapped at my roommate that "I didn't take the order, don't get an attitude with me BITCH." YES, HE CALLED HER A BITCH. He then grabbed the check and slammed it on the table and said "Don't leave a tip because it would be an insult." And procceded to cause a scene in the restaurant that caused another couple around us to leave the immediately. My roommate asked to see the manager and was told there was no manager there.

In my opinion, a meal from a restaurant with an  employee who verbally assaults a customer, has no manager available, ignores its customers unappologetically and has the most unprofessional and disgusting service I've ever witnessed IS NOT A MEAL YOU SHOULD PAY FOR. 

So we weren't going to. As we walked towards the door, we were bombarded by both the waitress and waiter working who demanded we pay for the meal since we ate the food, and the waiter who was hurling verbal insults proceeded to push past me to PHYSICALLY BLOCK THE DOOR with a phone in his hand threatening that we could not leave and then calling the police asking them to come because we did not pay-
Mid sentence we shoved money in his hand and walked out. 

Good riddance. I'm disgusted. The food was alright but the audacity of the service will leave a rotten taste in my mouth forever. An establishment as mismanaged and volatile as this should not be in business.
author: Julie G.

description: My friend likes to come here for happy hour when we meet to catch up.  I enjoy their food and will happily visit and eat.  They're getting 3 stars because of their service.  They're nice and everything, but there's no follow through. I have to always ask for something or flag them down to get it.  I once asked the waitress for more wasabi and she never returned.  I had to stand up, walk over to the counter to get it myself and the place only had 2 other tables with people, so it wasn't like she was completely burdened or overwhelmed.  I have more patience when it's busy, but when it's almost completely empty, I have zero tolerance.  Lastly, for some reason, their sake doesn't give me a buzz.  I think I had like 3 of them (large, hot ones) and didn't feel anything.  They deliver it piping hot, so be careful of the hot container.
author: Shaun W.

description:
out of all the sushi places in the Castro this is by far bae and I's fav place.

pros: friendly service, classy venue, large selection of sake, fresh quality rolls made by sushi chefs in front of you, a few tvs that support local sports teams, and two bathrooms. You can also order online and the delivery few is free with a $25 purchase. They even have a happy hour who doesn't love those!

My fav roll is the California crunch and bae likes the crunch unagi roll which are about $22 total after tax. The location is great, a little further up Castro and  18th street by Oz pizza (which I also recommend).
author: Mel L.

description:
The food at Wasabi Bistro is quite good. We had miso soup, which was remarkably tasty, and three rolls (Pink Lady, Tiger Roll, and Castro Roll), all of which were exceptionally good.

The reason for only three stars instead of five was the noise. This restaurant has almost no noise-absorbing material at all -- except the diners' clothes. Fewer than half the tables were occupied, yet we had to shout across the table to carry on a conversation. The owners must have spent a great deal of money on renovating this place (which used to be a chinese restaurant with a takeout counter), and it looks quite nice. Yet they seem to have spent zero dollars on making it a pleasant place for a meal with friends.

I'll probably go back to Wasabi Bistro -- but I'll carefully choose a time when it is nearly empty of other guests.
author: Russell M.

description: Probably the worst service I've ever had from a restaurant...went two days in a row thinking the first day was one off and the second day the service was actually worst. Rude staff. Seem as though I unconvinced the server for coming in to eat. Sushi is great but I will never return as the staff is dismissive and rude. Total of five customers in for lunch time happy hour, never could get a refill or even really saw the waiter. Sorry I gave this place two chances when the first impression was right.
author: Juddson K.

description: Good sushi. Good service. Too much rice, but it was tasty. They have happy hour sushi specials from 11:30-6:30pm daily.
author: Lon G.

description:
It was super nice and shiny inside, but the food wasn't very good..

and there was a bone in the sashimi...which is so wrong on so many levels..

I just kept thinking how many times they've reused that swirled fish body decoration on the plate...I point this out because the type of fish wasn't any of the kind of sashimi that was ordered...and the waiter awkwardly took it away which i thought was fishy...haha fishy get it?

We got some weird mango tango roll that was super disgusting...I had two pieces of it and tried to pawn it off to other people.
author: Anthony N.

description:
I took my family for lunch here and had a great time.  The service for lunch was fast and lots of room available with zero to no wait.  We were served ginger and endamame for appetizer and the Miso soup was just right before our luncheon.

The Sashimi was amazing, I had a variety of samplers thanks to Albert (also owner of Wasabi and Ginger at Van Ness).  The staff and people there are very friendly.

We had some amazing foods and Sashimi which will bring me back again, upon our next visit up to SF.  The sushi and selections is amazing, also love the ambiance and decor.
author: Andy C.

description: Waiting forty five minutes for food. Food didn't all come at once. Took ten minutes for a server to come to our table, and it's not that busy in here, just gloriously understaffed.
author: Kait A.

description:
I work on the street and hadn't tried Wasabi Bistro since it opened because I thought it was the previous sushi place that had a terrible Chinese place in front just getting a facelift. However I found it had different owners now. I used to be loyal to Osaka Sushi in the Castro for my healthy food meals (amazing a neigborhood full of gym bunnies mainly has heavy food restaurants), however Osaka's sushi a while back was noticeably not as fresh one day and never got better, and it was still hard to leave without paying $35/$40 for a simple small lunch of sushi. 

The interior looks nice. There's a host in the middle of the day waiting to seat you. They are super friendly. Don't let the fact that this place is empty fool you- it's good, just undiscovered! They have a large selection of food, some dishes such as the tuna tartare (delicious) have a california cuisine edge to them. I was impressed by the size of their side salad, and the price and quality were good (no iceberg lettuce). There is a large selection of hot and cold sakes. It's really easy to walk out of here after having a fresh, healthy, good tasting meal for around $25 for lunch (without being limited to the lunch special).

I highly recommend this place to all my clients who often ask where to eat in the Castro. I hope these guys succeed. If they can shake the old sushi place they'll do just fine.
author: Nick M.

description: It is amazing! I like the ramen here and the fresh oyster. They have good sushi roll here, especially the dragon roll and the pink lady.
author: Cathy G.

description:
The best hamachi Kama in the city! Great food and great service. Louis and Wendy are amazing. Super pleasant and friendly....
I highly recommend wasabi bistro! Thank you very much.
author: Leticia G.

description: Luis was a really good waiter who served us right. The food came quickly and they were all delicious.
author: Po Wei C.

description: Sadly, I have to downgrade my rating to just 1 star.  The service we have endured as of late has been absolutely abysmal.  They have consistently delivered the wrong orders, packed veggie sushi together side by side with regular fish sushi, and taken up to 2+ hours to make a delivery.  The sushi itself is generally of a good quality but the atrocious service has made it that we will never order from Wasabi again.  We've switched to Takara and have had a much better experience overall.
author: Saminda W.

description: I just had a wonderful dining experience here tonight. I normally don't yelp a business unless I've been truly impressed. Tonight, I was impressed. The food was amazing. The service was kind and fast. The chefs were very knowledgable about their craft. I sat at the bar and was having a great time watching them prep the food. The lamb was on point, the baby lobster was on point, the garlic shrimp was on point and the dessert was on point. I'll be coming back soon.
author: Jimmy U.

description: Best sushi I've ever tried since I came to SF so recommended and Jessie (the chef) was very nice to my husband and I too, great customer service.
author: Gabriela M.

description: Serena is the best. She is very attentive. The owner came to the table and got us sake bombs. Best place in town. A +++++
author: Rafael M.

description:
19-October, Friday:
I'll start this review with the bad points because this place is so inconsistent it is hard to place my finger on exactly why I feel so mixed, but basically here are my likes and dislikes.

CONS: 
The interior feels like I stepped into the faux version of Donatella Versace's banquet hall: smelly alligator pleather upholstered on the booth seating, which is hugged by a long beveled wall of mirrors before it turns into an accent wall of more alligator pleather in the back with a flatscreen hung in the center. In the front room there are 2 dangly chandeliers that are quite ridiculously over the top, and a harsh transition to slated walls that were either made of mock-porcelain, or something resin coasted with a low-sheen to it. 

-tuna poke: maybe a bit too much onion
- rainbow roll: was frighteningly awful, the salmon and tuna tasted a bit rough in texture and the level of freshness was definitely questionable. 

PROS:
Despite the atrocity of overwhelming decadence that is the interior, the service is always friendly, prompt, overly polite, and overly apologetic. Both times I've been here they have been very proactive about taking orders too soon, without giving me time to first breathe while I am still perusing the menu in an effort to make the best of informed decisions.  However, in the same breath plates of pickled ginger, wasabi, and edamame immediately come out upon seating, along with tall tumblers of iced water.

--miso: fresh bits of tofu very firm, light on the sodium, and perfect for the cold weather.
-spider roll: was nice and crisp
-gyoza: were cooked very well and had with the perfect amount of seared crisp
-walu nigiri: I was rather impressed with the excellent freshness, texture, and taste.
-castro roll: had a subtle severity to it, as the slices of fresh jalapenos complimented the sweet sauce really well

MAS-O-MENOS: so-so
-spring rolls: were descent 
-hamachi nigiri: I've had much better

I would probably come back here exclusively for the things I had good experiences with, since this place is conveniently located to where I live. And there aren't much better options in the Castro.
author: Ty T.

description: One word - mediocre. Service was in consistent.  All our food came out at different times.  By the time my food came out my dining companions were done with their meals.  The one good thing is that a glass of wine is inexpensive for SF - $6 to $9
author: Tom F.

description:
Strengths:  Traditional dishes with a twist like Yuzu Hirame and Garlic Edamame was very delicious.  Good assortment and very fresh sashimi.  Ask server for fresh grated wasabi!  Ankimo was very creamy.  Sparkling sake?---instant fan!

Weaknesses:  The restaurant is a lot bigger after the remodel and feels a little less personal, but now it is updated, open, and comfortable.  On the flip side...this makes a great place to have a large party.

Opportunities:  I think they are still improving their menu, but I think they would do well with more specialty dishes like the Yuzu Hirame and more sashimi and oyster options.

Threats:  At least 10 other sushi places within 4 blocks, where do I start?  

Total:  $120 for 2 ppl with drinks...quite a few are those darn sparkling sake.
author: Jenny K.

description: Omg this place has the best server in the world. Trina is the best and I really enjoyed my time at this place because of her. Also food was good and I am sure that I am coming back to this place :)
author: Brian J.

description: I'm tremendously disappointed by this restaurant, my friends and I came all the way from Los Angeles and the first place we stop to eat was here. First of all the waitress was rude from the beginning it took idk how long to get out drinks "waters." There was a long wait on our food and when it finally came out it was placed on our table in a manner that was so un professional. They confused our order and still gave us attitude even when the other waitress tried assisting. I can definitely guarantee you that I will never come back here and will not recommend this place to anyone.
author: Jonathan A.

description: The food is very delicious  and their services r very Profesional,  is the best sushi restaurant  in san Francisco  some food I had never try outside there, hope to be there again soon
author: Bing Y.

description:
Very innovative and fresh sushi menu!  The creativity of the menu caught my eye and in I went. 

I had the Hawaiian Roll, the Miso Salmon sushi, and the Baby Lobster sushi.

The presentation was top notch, and there was plenty of selection in terms of fresh seafood.  The two sushi selections were seared and well seasoned with garnish and sauce.

For those of you that don't do sushi, there's plenty of hot appetizers that looked amazing, whizzing by my table.  There is also a salad, robata, nabeyaki, and traditional food menu (labeled main dish). 

Despite being Friday, packed and crazy, my server Zeon still managed to be very attentive. Great!
author: Michael A.

description:
Always fresh always the best service. Owner is super friendly like a bucket of joy. 
Got to try their specials. 
Dont order anything you can find at a grocery store.
author: Phil T.

description:
The fish was so fresh and delicious, you can tell a lot of care was taken into preparing each roll. The customer service is what takes this place to the next level, very attentive and polite waiters. The ambiance is great, really like the decor. 

Finally the prices were very reasonable especially considering the area and how nice the interior of the restaurant is.
author: Rhonda J.

description: I tried so many sushi restaurant this is by far the best and everything is really fresh and delicious.
author: Luis L.

description:
Went out on a suggestion to Castro and I will have to say that I did enjoy myself. We got hungry after a few beverages and decided to give Wasabi Bistro a try. I must say that it was pretty delicious. I love getting fresh sushi and rolls with good combos. Usually when I dont know exactly how a place will taste i order very slowly and simple things. As I get the food try it and like it, i'll go ahead and get riskier. I ordered:

Warm Saki and a large Sapporo- to get us started =] 

Gyoza- Simple nothing out of the ordinary

Spicy Tuna- Was pretty good, was lacking spice but I just asked for a side of spicy mayo

Age Tofu- Very good. I love tofu so I was happy even with the amount! 

Scallops wrapped in bacon- They were good but nothing from what they were... The bacon over powered them a bit

Godzilla Roll- fried miso tuna topped with spicy crab

In conclusion very good, great service and would definitely return
author: Alex Dallas M.

description: Service at this place is slower than paint drying. What a mistake coming here. I feel like I'm dying slowly.
author: Marshall Z.

description: My aunt is visiting from Seattle and sushi is a must eat in SF.  Thank you for our friend Ling to recommend this place.. We ordered oysters and appetizers from Happy Hour menu that went well with drinks.. And the Ikura tastings and sashimi omakase are amazing.  High quality fish I must say.. We finished our meal w a nicely grilled hamachi Kama.. Crispy and juicy!  Owner Albert surprised us with mango Mochi w whipped cream and chocolate.. We can't wait to go back again soon!!!
author: Eva L.

description:
I read the reviews, and they seem pretty mixed. Unfortunately, this time, I have to side more on the negative side.

When I went, the restaurant was not too crowded. I was there with just one other friend. We waited almost 15-20 minutes for any sort of service. When the waitress finally showed up, all she said was, "Do you know what you want yet?" There was no greeting or introduction of any sort. That was disappointing. 

Once we ordered, it took about 25 minutes until we got our food. Before we could ask for more water, the server seemed to just book herself out of our table, so we couldn't ask for anything. 

The food was so-so. I love sushi, and I have definitely had better. 

I'm unsure if we were there on an off night, but I wasn't that pleased with the service or food.
author: Raymond G.

description: Definitely one of my favorite places to go! It's right by where I work so super convenient and everyone here is so nice! Excellent service! Every time I'm here Wendy or Serena are the ones who help me out and they both give excellent, friendly, and fun service every time!! They always remember me and it feels more like chatting with friends! Definitely love the vibe here and the food is AMAZING! I've only had great experiences! :)
author: Rachel D.

description:
WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!!! Ordered delivery on a Tuesday at 730pm. The promise to get it to you between 45-60min. The hour comes and goes and STILL nothing. So I call the restaurant after an hour and 20min and they say he is almost there. I hang up with the restaurant and he shows up 5min later.

I leave "special instructions" on my order to enter the door to the "lobby area" and come up to my place on the 3rd floor bc I have an injured leg right now. But...nope! He got here and rang the doorbell! I had to walk (er...more like hop) down 3 flights of stairs to get the food. When I open door,?it was so bizarre! He just handed me the bag and left! 

So I get inside after 15 min of trying to get up the stairs on a bum leg and open up my bag... the first thing I wanted to eat was my baked green mussels and they were COLD!!! and the sauce that covers the top of the mussel was sooooo hard! when I bit into it, it made a crunching sound like a chip!

THEN I decided to eat my sushi (nigiri) and I had NO WASABI OR GINGER!!!! I had even asked for it in my order. CAN THIS REALLY BE HAPPENING??? I don't know about you, but I don't like to eat my sushi without wasabi!

So I call them back (for the 2nd time) at 9pm and they say he will bring me some. He didn't bring it for another 45min!!!!! By this time it's damn near 10PM when I ordered at 7:27pm!!! At this point, I wasn't even HUNGRY anymore!

TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TEEEEERRRRRRIBBLLLLEEEE EXPERIENCE! 

I cannot speak to what it's like to dine in but I CAN advise you to NOT do delivery!
author: Becca B.

description:
I've only gotten delivery here, so I can't comment on the restaurant itself, but the delivery experience is great.

Chirashi bowl = solid
Snow crab hand roll = awesome

I've tried other delivery chirashi bowls and they were meh. This one's def my favorite. Fish is pretty fresh and the sushi rice is the best I've had from delivery (and in general -- second only to Kiji). Also comes with a bit of wakame so I don't have to order that separately.
author: Rhea K.

description:
This place reminds me of home.  I ordered a ton of food and it all tasted good.  They looked at me and my friends like, you are a pro at ordering.  The best way to enjoy is to have a good selection, not just get one entree and eat.  Share, be merry!  

I enjoyed the atmosphere and good company always enhances an experience.  I think that the menu is good for anyone, there's something for everyone.

It's a good spot for a nice dinner.
author: Jamila J.

description: Went on a weeknight. It was empty. Sat at the bar. Ordered toro, hamachi, spicy tuna hand roll, & fried/tempura shishito peppers. (So awsome they have tempura shisito peppers). Drank some Saki. Can't complain at all. This is a great sushi restaurant the quality of the food was above par.
author: Shannon R.

description:
Super nice sushi restaurant in the Castro. The seafood is extremely fresh. The atmosphere is very comfortable,  good for a romantic dinner for two or a big group too.

I went with a group of 9 other people and we really enjoyed ourselves.
author: Scott O.

description: Excellent place to go to! I've been going regularly for about a year and never had a negative experience! Serena and Wendy are especially great. Even when walking by, I'll stop in just to say hi. These two are very personable and present such a warm welcoming environment! I'll continue to come here and recommend it to others. Part of a good dining experience is the service, and the service here will exceed expectations
author: Bashir Z.

description:
I was a little disappointed by the food at this price level.  The only dish I would eat again was the fried tempura which deserves 4 to 5 stars.  The service and atmosphere were also good.  I'll also mention that being vegan I ordered all vegetable rolls and dishes. 

The tofu steak was drowning in a sea of soy sauce and was too salty for me.  It was also crisp outside but mushy inside.  I would expect firm tofu to call this a steak. My sense is that the chef added it to the menu just to please vegetarians but does not really care how it tastes. The veggie dragon roll was pretty bland and the ratio of rice was too high. It was like eating plain rice garnished with a little avocado. 

Next the potstickers were mushy and the dipping sauce way too salty for this dog. With tip the meal was close to $50 and was generally disappointing due to the food alone.
author: Ryder M.

description:
I chose wasabi over a number of other local sushi spots to host a large group last night and I'm glad I did.

The hostess and staff provide a lovely large table and provided edamame as a free appetizer which charmed our foreign guests :)

The hit by far was the sashimi chirashi with all and everyone marveling about the variety and volume of the fresh fish.

It was delightful and the service was attentive and capable.

I highly recommend it for the quality and value of the chirashi and the outstanding service and hospitality.
author: david f.

description:
I ordered the pork ramen and it was delivered cold and no noodles. 
Haven't been back and won't go back. 
Between my experience and a mile long list of horror stories from friends we'd much rather go elsewhere.
author: Jake S.

description:
Seasons closed along with its next door establishment, which was a low-end Chinese place for mostly take-out. These places are now combined into space called Wasabi Bistro. The large windows in the front are great for both diners and passerbys.

The first time I went, I got the chirashi, my favorite sushi dish. Basically a bunch of sashimi over a bowl of rice. The sushi was all fresh and the sushi rice was tasty. As was the ginger and wasabi. Absent in the dish were pickles, though some spicy sprouts were there. The dish was $14, which is about on par with the other places in the area. I ordered miso soup, which did not come with the lunch special (it should.) The miso was good.

However, on another visit, I got the sushi nigiri combo. One of the snapper pieces was completely inedible. Chewy, scaley, unfresh tasting. Really so terrible that I have never gone back since. I have eaten a lot of sushi in my life and have never been served something that terrible.

Takara remains my favorite choice in the area.
author: Aaron W.

description:
I'm really not sure how this place gets a Yelp 4-star review.  We came in last night, and sat approximately 15 minutes before a server came by.  We weren't even asked if we wanted drinks during the wait!  Meanwhile the front door's broken and swinging in the wind (my girlfriend complained of being cold).  And there's BLOODY MURDERED BODIES on the TV screens throughout the place, courtesy CSI: Miami on 3 giant TV screens.  The human blood and guts was pretty unappetizing.  We managed to get the attention of our waitress after 5 minutes, now with the murdered bodies being dissected at the morgue on the TV... She said she'd change it.  But she forgot.  5 minutes later, I told her, "Listen, we were actually serious about not wanting to see dead people while we're eating."  She did fix it then...

Anyway, the food was unremarkable.  They said they had hamachi belly, but they didn't.  So I had some hamachi, and it was rubbery.  Certainly not worth savoring in any way.  We also had some rolls, which were pretty decent... Though one was overly sweet and hella fatty (deep fried).  The garlic edamame were very good.

But back to the service... So my girlfriend's vegetarian, and we ordered her stuff very clearly as "the vegetarian stuff"... Then the food comes out, all vegetarian stuff first, then all the fish!  So I got to watch her eat (well OK I stole a bunch of it) and then she got to watch me eat.  Really?  Seems like that could have been done better.

All in all, the only explanation for the high rating must be the prices.  Because it was actually pretty cheap.  I would much rather pay for something a little better though.
author: Jon E.

description: We popped in for happy hour and had a delightful experience. Our server was prompt and lovely, the asparagus rolls were fresh, sake hot and oysters tasty. Would gladly come back.
author: Shalana M.

description:
I have become a regular at this place. The sushi chefs all know their stuff. The selection is not huge, but it is high quality and fresh.  The sauces, an integral part of sushi, are excellent. The dishes unique to them are great.

There is no place for miles around I would rather go to either for sushi, rolls, katsu, Japanese curry, and other dishes.
author: Dennis W.

description:
Um.A great experience sake and yummy food.  A very yummy waiter Eric.  Great tasty
.  Fine.  Eric was sweet and was nicevwhemn we flirtef.   I want to hug him.
author: allen C.

description:
How can you review AMAZING?!?! The man in charge Albert will taylor your order for you. He knows his fish and the staff is friendly and great. 

Hands down.... This place is AMAZING and my new favorite place!
author: Natalina C.

description:
After a leisurely day, my friends and I dined here for our first dinner of 2013.   We shared several plates and rolls.   Ordered were the beef robata, smoked salmon, akimo (monk liver fish), chicken karaage (not on menu), chicken teriyaki, pink lady roll, and several other rolls that I cannot remember.    

Most of the food was OK in taste except for the pink lady roll.  The roll is served with some odd sauce over the salmon layer.   The sauce was not to my liking.  

Service was slow that evening, though it wasn't really crowded. I would say it was a little over half capacity.  Our server though was very good, as she was attentive to what we ordered.  She provided an extra large salad and 4 miso soups for our (at the time) 1 plate order. And she also corrected the chicken karaage portion size, as she noticed they brought out an appetizer portion.
author: Marck N.

description:
This is regarding the take out. I ordered the Sake (Salmon) and Maguro (Tuna) Nigiri, Q Madness and Miso Soup.

The food was very ordinary. Fish was mediocre quality at best. The Q Madness tasted very 'fishy', not like lobster and tuna. If you ordered something that had a strong sauce and hid the quality of the fish, you'd probably have a much better time than i did. Miso soup was fine.

Delivery: Very disappointing. It says 45-60 minutes and it took over 80 minutes. They sent someone who couldn't speak english or navigate, and complained about the parking (despite there being available free parking directly outside). Definitely a sub-par experience.

Would I order takeout from here again? Definitely not.
Would I come here for a sit-down meal? I'd give it another chance.
author: Zac A.

description:
We ordered 3 of their rolls and they were all good except for the Pricess roll. It had salmon and some sort of mayonaise sauce and it tasted really horrible. That needs to be axed from the menu. The spicy tuna and spider rolls were good .I can't say how good  their nigiri is since we only had the rolls. I'm always skeptical if the sushi chef isn't Japanese because I know to be a sushi chef in Japan takes years of apprenticeship and training.

We ordered other stuff off the menu which was surprisingly good, and some misses. The hamachi kama was good. Fried tofu, good. The bbq beef was good too. One thing that was not on the menu but you should try is chicken karaage (fried chicken). That was a winner.

Some of the not so good. Aside from the Princess roll mentioned above, the Teriyaki chicken - this was just grilled chicken with a sweet teriyaki sauce on it. Kinda dry. I'm used to my teriyaki chicken being marinated. We also had ankimo, which is supposed to be the foie gras of the sea. I think it sat a little too long because it didn't have that rich, buttery flavor its supposed to have. I found the taste to be rather flat. 

The service was good. It took a while to get our initial order in because there was a large party next to us, but they were attentive.
author: Kenson K.

description:
It was my birthday, my friends told me to pick a place for dinner. I'm new to the city, but not to the Bay, so I found this place on Yelp, thought it looked pretty classy, and sent out the link so my friend could make the reservation.

Tuesday night, 8 pm, the restaurant is basically empty and we get our pick of tables. Now that I think about it, it's probably because the Giants' World Series game was on, although there are TVs at this restaurant too. 

I'll admit, the empty tables were worrisome at first, but the service was all the more attentive for it. We were immediately offered water and edamame. My friend brought a coupon for a free crunchy CA roll for a purchase over $35, which apparently can only be redeemed if you order online. But since we didn't know that, and because it was my birthday, the waiter told us that they'd honor the coupon anyway. So far, so good...

We ordered 6 rolls: X, Kamikaze, Martini, Miso Salmon, Crunchy CA, and Volcano. The Martini and Crunchy CA were fried really well and the Martini roll is actually served in a martini glass! As a salmon lover, the Miso Salmon roll was right up my alley. All the fish was very fresh.

We also ordered 3 of the soju cocktails, which were hit and miss. My passion cocktail (soju, pineapple juice, mango juice), was definitely the hit. Not very strong, but very delicious.

After we finished--free dessert (since it was my birthday and all)! The waiter (I wish we knew his name!) brought a plate of mint chocolate and coffee ice cream mochi with some chocolate syrup in a flower pattern, and he and my friends started a round of Happy Birthday, all in different keys. Very cute, and I love both mint chocolate and coffee ice cream.

Give this place a shot. I sure am glad I did, especially on an important occasion like a birthday. We're talking about returning for those $1 oysters during happy hour...
author: Sharon L.

description: Im here again ... bravo. .  Wonderful service and very nice food... fresh oyster... lamb is delicious.
author: Sally C.

description: This is a nice spot, cool happy hour. Wish there was more on the menu that I'd order, but beggars can't be choosers. My favorite roll here is the walnut roll. Sauce is on point!!! 3 stars only because when gave the waitress my leftovers to pack up this homeless guy walked by and grabbed it off the plate to eat! Yeah pretty gross.
author: Ashley M.

description: Happy hour, wandered in, long long wait before being acknowledged. Even longer wait for food to come. Won't come back.
author: Loren H.

description: This review is for lunch only.  Btw, happy hour specials start at 11:30am. We ordered the Rainbow and Volcano Rolls to share (NOT on the HH menu) and the grilled asparagus and Boston Roll from the HH menu.  Everything arrived quickly, was fresh/perfectly seasoned and hit the spot, especially the Rainbow Roll (wanted the Sushi Combo and we were sharing rolls).  Can't wait to come back again!
author: M G.

description: I am a regular until now. My partner and I come here regularly because its convenient to where we reside. Today was different from every other day(fruit flys). I know most of the waiters so they know exactly what I order as soon as I walk in. After we have our dinner and we pay, the lady today(probably the owner) she is outraged because I sign the customer copy(note, I never take any copy, whether its my copy or their copy) and we walk out to leave, chases us down embarrassingly to let us know. And I didn't understand, I tip 22% over the regular. The food isn't great. Try going to "Sushi time" on 16th its always better just a lil smaller.
author: Lynton M.

description: Excellent lunch and happy hour specials.  I had the miso salmon, assorted sashimi and 6 oyster shooters. All excellent and all an excellent value. I'm glad I walked by and decided to go in for lunch. Wendy was very nice and helpful, too. Great service.
author: Stephen C.

description: Good taste and good serives, I love the uni salmon roe sashimi is the best ever!!!! Highly recommend!!!
author: Xiaoxin H.

description:
I stumbled upon this place with my boyfriend when we were in the city, and I am so happy that we chose this sushi restaurant! 

We were greeted immediately by the hostess and were able to sit in one of the booths. The decor of the restaurant was absolutely beautiful. With the Its dim lighting, it is perfect for date night.

We ordered a lot of different nigiri and all of them tasted extremely fresh and delicious. The lobster nigiri was my personal favorite. My boyfriend and I love spicy anything, so we gave the shishito peppers a try, and we loved it! It wasn't burning our mouth hot but they definitely had a kick to them. We also ordered uni. To be honest, I am not a fan of uni but the uni at Wasabi Bistro might have changed my mind. I always have room for dessert, so of course we ordered tempura ice cream. And, it was perfectly crispy on the outside and cool and refreshing on the inside.

In the middle of our dinner the owner, Albert, came by our table and asked how our food was and gave me and my boyfriend a complimentary beer. He was kind and genuinely wanted to know our opinions on his restaurant. 

If you are in the city and near the Castro district, I would highly recommend you try this sushi restaurant. Five stars all around!
author: Jessica N.

description:
Tonight was very loud and it appears their service is lacking. Food known to be the star at this restaurant unfortunately was a no show. 

Bright spot. Loud group that the four servers tended to left.

Will reconsider returning.....more compelling restaurant s in the area to venture towards.
author: Edgar M.

description:
I came across wasabi bistro while I was window shopping in Castro, the decor was the first thing that really caught my attention, thus, I decided to give it a shot. 

Food was great, comforting and creative. And the wonderful service I got would mark the top reason for my returning in the future. My server, Kai, was friendly,professional, humorous, attentive and witty.

He made sure I had everything I needed and was very attended to details.  Even though I didnt order much, he still provided me with a stellar service. I can't emphasis enough the importance of good customer service, it goes hand in hand with good quality food and products. Lacking of either just wouldn't cut it and wasabi bistro is a great example of both quality service and food.
author: Tracy H.

description:
1) Overly salty miso soup
2) Butane soaked Castro roll
3) Grisly tough toro tartare with overripe avocados for $18 !!!!!
4) A mound tofu chunks
5) Scallops that were so badly over cooked they could have been used as bouncy balls.

There was one roll that was ok at best but I can't remember the name of it. 

We should have know since it was empty on a Friday night and we were trying to wait out the traffic. Ugh. 

The food was pretty awful. The atmosphere was weird. Loud lounge music, a basketball game on, and some chick flick on another TV. It was a sureal strange scene! I don't think I ever want to repeat.
author: Jill T.

description: This is a nice venue with ample seating. There's happy hour from 1130-6 offering sushi rolls for $4-5. The sushi was good especially for the price and the service was adequate.
author: Charlotte A.

description:
I've come here on numerous occasions and honestly, I don't have anything to complain about. The staff is great. Especially the owner, he's hilarious. He makes sure he does his round to see how every table is doing and converse a little. Very hands on. Impressive. 
Everything I've tried here has been a success for me. But my recent visit I tried something that I just fell in love with? Try the miso salmon! It just melts in your mouth. Loved it!
author: Hailee K.

description:
Convenient neighborhood Japanese restaurant with great service.  They have the standard different Japanese varieties of food, including sushi, donburi, noodles, rice dishes, etc.  They have their own creative fusion type dishes that are pretty good.

The waiters are great and give good service.  They are also happy to make changes to their standard dishes to my liking, so I often go there.  

Price is reasonable.
author: Henry S.

description: I really like the sashimi by the sushi chef (creative) , pleasant environment and highly recommend..
author: Angel C.

description:
The food was great, the service was exceptional and the music was popping. I would definitely go back!!!

We order the niku donburi which was amazing, exceeded expectation.
author: Naimah M.

description:
Celebrated my wife's birthday there on Saturday with family and friends.  Parking is a pain right now cause Castro is all torn up and you gotta hit the side streets and or park blocks away.

Had reservations for our group and the table was all ready for us upon arrival.  Albert (owner/operator) along with his staff served us personally.  

Started off with appetizers and cocktails before ordering dinner, sushi and more cocktails.

The food was absolutely delicious and the personal attention we received was awesome!  The place was pretty full with maybe a few tables open but it's a big sushi house and you couldn't tell that from the outside.  It's definitely a bit more upscale than most of the sushi places I've been to.

We live in the San Mateo/Foster City area so we had a bit of a drive just to get there.  It was well worth the drive and the time to find parking.

We'll definitely be back!
author: Ashley C.

description: Loved the assorted sashimi (especially scallop and toro), uni Ikura tasting spoons, waygu beef tataki, baby lobster nigiri. Not to mention they have a great sake selection.
author: Shannon J.

description:
I'm from the other side of the US - Charlotte, NC. Been to NYC, DC, Atlanta, Vegas, Portland, you name it, but I make it a point to come here every trip I take to San Fran because the freakin' California Roll, of all things is AMAZING! And it's the simplest, most common roll in the world, but here it is new and different and magical! 

The main entrees aren't as great, but everything leading up to from the salad to the sushi is ridiculously good!!! Just go all in on the sushi instead of a full entree!
author: Gary C.

description: Delicious and well priced food, and close to transport. Service great too, and food out fast.
author: Andrew M.

description: I like this neighborhood place. It's a trendy spot. The happy hour is really good. My fav is the Tiger roll. I wasn't a fan of the ramen. Other than that everything else I have tried has been good. It hits the spot when you are in the mood for some sushi!
author: Nawal W.

description: three to six pm happy hour at wasabi bistro...$four large hot house sake or beer?...take both...$dollar oysters?...take four...lightly sauced, quite fresh and wedge of lemon squeeze...sweet, tangy and a perfect slurp...$two.ninety-five hand rolls?...take one of those too...rice, filling and roll mediocre, but fine for roughly $four total...slightly buzzed, slightly filled, slightly under $twenty total, slightly worth happy hour pricing...
author: Hen A.

description: Wow. Came here for a meeting with my room mate and girlfriend I was disappointed by the representation of the queer community by this QUEEN. I'm ok with some snarky remarks but to call my friend a bitch after he avoided us for 30 minutes while our waitress was on break was just plain annoying. You lost my business and respect, I love the Castro for its vitality and personality but this was plain gross ugly behavior. I'm sad to see the queer community represented like this jerk .. And when I brought it up to my waitress when she came back to offer us complimentary sake, she said " bitch is just a nickname we use". I'm sorry to the families who saw this scene, and to anyone else. This guy definitely deserves a nomination for an Oscar. Oh and he told us not to tip because it would be an insult.
author: Chauntae M.

description: My sushi was covered in fruit flies. Also, the special Castro Roll tastes like lighter fluid.
author: Morris R.

description: Went in during their happy hour and over all it gets a 5 start for being clean, great service, welcoming staff, food was out of this world, and fair price. I will sure to come back.
author: Zack T.

description: Great atmosphere. We dined in and we had oysters, philly roll, Boston roll and calamari. The food was superb and perfect before our night out! Highly recommend :) ask for Wendy !
author: Ben T.

description:
What would you call a roll which had:
 - mediocre fish
 - unimaginative menu
 - European-style service
 - weird, hipster, d-bag customers
 - high prices

I'd call it the Wasabi Bistro roll.
author: Tim W.

description: $1 oysters even on weekends! Delicious happy hour menu!  Whole fish aji sashimi style with crunchy fried fish bones for $18. Can' beat that. This is a well secret in Castro.
author: Mark W.

description: Always have had a great experience here! On our last visit the server remembered us and reminded us what we had the time before. The Castro roll is amazing as are all the other speciality rolls we've had over the past several visits. We've been twice on this visit to SF alone.
author: Michael G.

description:
My new favce sushi spot in Castro. Big, fresh, juicy chunks of fish for sashimi and a yummy specialty roll. Service is impeccable. Get salmon belly sushi!

[The above was written back in August 2013.  I just realized that I have not posted it.]
author: Marina S.

description: Nice clean glam space w a Vegas vibe. Great happy hour specials. Really nice service. Food was fresh and tasty.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Was very concerned when I saw high percentage of "spicy" rolls on the menu. In my experience this has been an attempt to mask low quality or less than fresh fish.  I am not a spicy tuna fan.  If I wan't to add chiracha to my food I will do it myself so I NEVER order anything on the menu with spicy tuna or a lot of sauce like ponzu or unagi sauce.  When I order Sushi I want to enjoy the flavor and texture of the fresh fish. Because of that this menu made it very difficult to order any rolls. I ended up order nigri: maguro, hamachi and hamachi toro., a rainbow roll, and and X roll which did have a spicy sauce.   

They brought the Nigiri first and was quite pleased with the freshness and portion of fish to rice. The maguro was one of the best I had in a while.  Then came the X roll.  very nice roll with salon and tuna on top, but drizzled in a typical chiracha based sauce.  Once I wiped that off it was pretty good.  Then came what I thought was the safe roll.  the Rainbow Roll.  It touted no imitation crap, they used snow crab instead with avocado and then an assortment of fish on top.  Well it may or may not have been imitation crab, but it was the worse crab salad in a rainbow roll I have had in a long while.  I ate the fish and avocado off it and left the roll. 

When I told the waiter what I thought he thanked me and said that he appreciated the feedback because that is the only way they can learn and grow.  He also brought green tea ice cream as an apology. 

To wrap it up. The fish buyer seems on top of it.  If I came back I would probably stick with Nigiri Chirashi or Sashimi.  The Menu really misses the mark for me. Place is a bit too Hipster Hong Kong and prices are a bit high, but it is the heart of the Castro so their rent is probably outrageous.   Oh, and the host if very HOT.

I won't be rushing back
author: Jerry W.

description:
The only thing I have to complain about is the forgetfulness of our waiter. I ordered a sampler and was expecting it to come before the main entree and sushi roll but alas it came at the very end when everyone, including myself were done eating. He was super nice about it, giving me back rubs so I guess I can forgive him this time otherwise Bonquisha will come out the next time. 
What can I say, the sampler was to die for, fresh, light and yes, umami! The roll was delicious and the tako nigiri also mouth watering. The reason for the 3 stars is because there are so many more place in SF to try I just couldn't give all my goodies to one establishment. All in all come out and try it!
author: Victor A.

description:
The food is average, the look is modern/new (much needed for Castro), the service is ok.  Well that was until they sat a couple on Coke, right next to my friend and I, when the restaurant was completely empty.  The couple they seated next to us, was overly loud and I do swear they were on Coke, they were both talking at 50 miles per hour and barely took a breath between sentences, their conversations did not even match each other.  I don't know if maybe the server thought we were rude and getting back at us or something but it was one of the worst restaurant experiences I've ever had.

But again, the food was just fine, nothing special, nothing great, but not bad.  I am a firm believer that if I'm going to a place to pay for someone else to prepare my food, it should be pretty darn good and absolutely better than I could do myself.  Unfortunately, this place failed way too many places do.
author: Jason B.

description: HAPPY HOUR $1 oysters. They have a special japanese sauce serve with raw oysters that is utterly delicious.
author: May N.

description: Food was OK. Server wasn't happy to split checks. Only 3,000 other sushi restaurants to choose from in this city.
author: Michael T.

description:
The sushi is horrible. I don't know how anyone can give the food more than two stars. We started off with some basic rolls: california and spicy tuna. Both of the rolls tasted bland and old. We also had the veg dragon roll which was also a disaster. The sweet potato tempura was incredibly bland. My wife ordered the stuffed mushrooms - soggy and gross. 

Service on the other hand is great. Very friendly wait staff!
author: R Z.

description:
This place is amazing .. 
Very good quality products .. very good prices and in the middle of the Gaytho .. 
We have been there several time and always have been very happy with the food .. more than happy ... 

Oh .. they have an happy hour with sushis and meal from 3pm ... to 5 pm ... 

Go there and you'll love it !
author: Nicolas D.

description:
I've only eaten here for lunch, but I thought it was very good.  Lots of options/combinations for a reasonable price.  

I left full and content with my meal. 

The interior is swanky, and the staff was really nice.  Go check them out.
author: Margaret I.

description:
The food is absolutely incredible and the staff is extremely accommodating. My partner and I arrived at the restaurant at 9:50 pm, and we never felt as though we had to rush to order and eat dinner. Also the staff was very helpful in patiently going through the television channels to find the particular station we wanted to watch. We will definitely return and will also tell everyone we know to support such an amazing, consistent establishment.

JOHN and DEREK
author: JOHN O.

description:
Really good fresh sushi

The staff is friendly. Albert the manager and Sarah were great to come to our table and give us some suggestions.

The quality of the fresh catch was one of the best in the city. Prices were reasinable too and good Sake too.

I felt spoilt and may get used to it.
author: Vik L.

description:
The lack of understanding  regarding customer service here is really indescribable. They screwed up my delivery. I waited two hours for a replacement and then I had to call them back, where they told me that I didn't order what I'm seeing on the screen.
I don't have time for this crap.
Totally lacking sushi - nothing really Japanese about it. Better off taking your business somewhere where you're appreciated.

Fail.
author: John J.

description:
Update: bumped review up to three stars given the response from management alleviating most of the below concerns.

When asked which of their fish were caught "sustainably", our server emphatically (and very confidently) responded "all of them".  To follow up, we asked if they served blue fin tuna, and our server proceeded "oh YES, and it's delicious!".  

If you know anything about seafood sustainability, you know that the blue fin tuna industry is among the most egregious of all fisheries. Google it, and boycott this restaurant.  96% of the world's Blue Fin Tuna are gone already, and a full 90% of what's left are got before they have a chance to reproduce.   

If you'd like your children to eat fish, boycott this and other restaurants like it.  If you're interested in learning more about the state of the worlds fish species, go visit the Monterey Bay Aquarium, which is at the forefront of knowledge on the topic.

PS. the food was great, the service good, and the prices reasonable for what you got.  If it weren't for this total disregard for the environment this place would have gotten 4 stars.
author: otto h.

description: Went here during a very busy day on Pride weekend. The wait was about 20 minutes which wasn't too bad considering how packed it was. We ordered veggie udon, a sashimi bowl, and a hand roll. The hand roll was pretty tiny for the price and a bit bland to me; however, the udon and sashimi made up a great deal for it. The soup was very yummy with lots of veggies and the sashimi tasted very nice, fresh, and cold. It was a bit hard to get servers' attention at times but I figured it was due to the heavy crowd of that night's event. I would go here again if I was ever in the area.
author: Jane M.

description:
The food is good but the delivery service is as bad as it gets. Food was 35 minutes over the longest expected delivery time and then the driver tells me to come down to his car to get my food when it did get here. I told him to please bring it up and he refused. 

Terrible. Don't order delivery from this place.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Four stars for great service and people. 

Came in on a Sunday and the restaurant was really hot. The edamame was dry and had been sitting out all day; mushy on the outside.  Agedashi was fine, hard to screw up and the sf roll was fine. 

Maybe give it another try.
author: stephanie b.

description:
Awesome!!!

Great happy hour sushi rolls. Fish is really fresh and flavored are solid.
author: Best M.

description: This is one of my favorite sushi joints in Castro.  Some of the freshest sashimi and sushi with great presentation too.  Gotta love the ambience which is complimented by great customer service. Five stars!
author: Aaron H.

description:
I love sushi, have tried many many sushi places in the city and all over the bay area.  This is the only sushi place I tried in the castro, not my favorite neighborhood since there were (are) so many naked people and semi naked people walking around, lol.

However, a friend of mine invited us to Wasabi Bistro, so we stop by for a dinner of 6.  Well, I found the design to be cool and very welcoming, pretty cozy with updated decorations of black accents, with a full size bar and lots of sake selections!

The food was awesome, with very fresh and tasty sashimis, yummy.  The service was fast considering it was a pack house on a Friday evening, the lady that worked the shift had a very good smile and always attentive to each of her tables, good job!

Check this place out if you are nearby and don't mind the odd atmosphere of the Castro, and I'm sure you won't be disappointed.
author: Tiger L.

description:
I went on a Wednesday night after getting my hair cut in the area and was craving some sushi. I probably wouldn't have gone if I looked at the reviews on here a head of time, so I am glad I didn't! This place was very good! I was stuffed by the time I left as it was so good, I just kept ordering more. 

The hand-rolls are extremely fresh and well prepared. You could taste the crunch of the nori and the freshness of the fish. Definitely some of the best hand-rolls I have had. The sushi was pretty good too, but I just got the standard Rainbow roll and 49er roll. Nothing too fancy, yet I was extremely excited that they use real crab in their rolls! It is so hard to find a good sushi place who also uses real crab. 

The only negative that I had was that the wasabi was really weak/mild. I had to use a lot to get any sort of kick. 

I will agree with another Yelp review in that it is a weird ambiance in the place (lounge music, sports game on the TVs, etc), but it would not prevent me from going back.  The service was also very friendly as well. The sushi chefs were attentive and friendly, and the waitress was also sure to check in with me every now and then to see if I needed anything. 

If you are in the area, definitely a good sushi spot.
author: Lauren C.

description: UGH.  Yelpers, wtf are you guys smokin'??  This place was terrible.  i'll excusse the awful service because it was pride, but the sushi was almost unpalatable.
author: Helen F.

description: The food was not so bad - not very tasty - but the service was very bad and disorganized. There was like 20 minutes between the first person being served and the last one, so she had to eat alone.
author: Edwin W.

description:
I cannot talk about the quality of the food or ambiance, because we never received our change back from the waiter last night. It was a $74 bill, and we gave $100, and we waited and waited and waited and waited. The staff was closing up and the waiter completely avoided coming back to our table. Really? NEVER presume a tip. We were planning on leaving 20% or more, and we were happy awesome customers, until you did not come back to our table and avoided saying goodbye or anything.

We did not deserve that. My boyfriend wanted to say something and we tried to catch the waiter's eye and the waiter actually just stayed in the kitchen. I did not want to quibble about a few dollars, so we left. But you know what, you stole from us. We were so nice and told you how much we enjoyed stuff, and you stole from us. You do NOT determine your own tip, and you stole from us. If you were so willing to steal cash, how can anyone believe this restaurant will keep your credit card information safe? 

Management, you have anything to say?
author: Priya R.

description:
Gays and sushi. Apparently these two things go hand and hand. However, outside of a couple spots, the Castro doesn't have that many raw fish joints. The sleek Wasabi Sushi making it's debut on the infamous street feels right at home. 

Opened later than most (the profile here says 11pm, but I could've sworn I went much later), the trendy and sexy joint serves up most regular-expected rolls plus some bitchin' appetizers. Complete with a hefty beer and wine selection, the place is good to go.

Primo location will probably knock Takara out of the running for places my tummy wants to go to when needing a salmon fix.
author: Jon C.

description:
We went here on Monday. The restaurant is nice. Food was  good and beautiful presentation. The problem is the noise. You barely could hear anything your friend says.
The restaurant was not that busy. I cannot imagine that how noisy it would be when they are full.
author: Thuy L.

description: This place has been opened for a year and this is my first time dining. Came in straight from work on a weekday around 5 for happy hour and the place was pretty much empty aside from a few tables. The space is huge and very nicely decorated in black and gems. Happy hour menu looks good. We got the $4 hot sake and a few appetizers including calamari, a couple of hand rolls, oysters (min is 6), and a roll. Everything was good, not bad for happy hour prices. Waiter was friendly, service was quick.
author: Vinkin Ken T.

description:
This is the Castro!  Only in San Francisco can you find the best, freshest sushi and sashimi in an over the top restaruant with Chandeliers!

I was a little nervous at first glance when I walked in with my friends because this is not a traditional Japanese restaruant with all the shoji doors, and rice paper and matted walls.  This place is in your face modern and upscale different...Just like the Castro!  
 We were immediately greeted by the owner, Albert who I recognized from another great sushi place in Millbrae.  We were served complimentary Soy beans with just the right amount of savory goodness.  

The specialty dishes are really the hit here with one of the freshest scallop dishes I have ever eaten in my life.  Sweet, fresh and firm coolness just eased down my gullet and into my belly!  

My litmus test is always the fresh tuna shashimi and the quality of sushi rice.  The rice had just the right amount of sweetness and tanginess that helps to compliment the fresh, sweet, red colored tuna.

Come here when you want to entertain guests and allow yourself to have a few drinks and get your party on!
author: Curtis L.

description:
Food was amazing!!! Service was bad, they did not ask to take drink order till almost 20 minutes after we were seated. Would understand if busy, but they only three tables at that point. Reason, "had important things to take care of in back"? Last time I checked the customer was the important thing. Also forgot to bring desert menu before bringing bill even after requesting it. Overall amazing food!! Just don't expect great service.

Update, They have totally revamped their service and their food is still amazing!
author: Ron J.

description:
Yet another mediocre restaurant serving Japanese food prepared by non-Japanese people.  This remodeled space is atrocious.  There are too many elements, giving the place a hodge-podge feel.  The seats are covered in black, alligator pleather.  One wall is cream and gold vertical tile, while the opposite wall is a framed, mirrored finished, while the wall behind the bar and the floor are different yet again.  The lighting all looks like it came from one of those cheap discount warehouses in SOMA and there are TV's playing sports alongside music that simply makes no sense.  

The food is just not right.  My partner ordered the chicken teriyaki and I had the chicken udon soup.  The chicken is paper thin, and I do mean paper thin.  Rather than a tender morsel, it feels more like chewing wet, chicken jerky.  The miso soup tastes like it's the freeze dried/rehydrated kind you get at the supermarket and the soup broth was simply brown and salty (perhaps thinned Oyster sauce)?  The food really tasted like Chinese food, meant to look Japanese.  The quality of ingredients seemed subpar (is this where they cut cost to pay for all that tacky remodeling

The prices were simply outrageous; $15.95 for a chicken teriyaki lunch special with 3 tablespoons of paper thin, chewy meat, and a similarly priced, bowl of salty brown udon, accompanied by the same, lackluster, processed looking chicken meat.
Barracuda on Market or Takara Sushi on 18th if one must have Japanese in the Castro, never, ever Wasabi Bistro.
author: Dwayne R.

description:
Fabulous sushi. Everything was fresh and delicious. 
We were served free edamame within minutes of  sitting down. Happy hour had just ended, but we were still allowed to order from the specials.
Other than the sushi, the agadashi tofu was also excellent and a huge serving. 
Ditto for the miso glazed eggplant.
Free ice cream at the end of the meal.
Very reasonably priced.
Highly recommended!
author: Carla B.

description:
I've been here almost 10 times. It's open late. No attitude. Their sushi is the best in the Castro. I
It wouldn't compare with the awesome sushi outside of this neighborhood however. 
But the waitstaff is friendly and fast enough, including the manager who tries to greet everyone in a genuine way. It's big so there's usually no waiting. 
I used to love Tokyo A GoGo and one of their sushi chefs works here. That's a good sign. And they give you a little bowl of edamame on the house. The decor is whacky which makes it feel unpretentious. And it looks pretty spotless.
author: Marga G.

description:
This place looks a lot nicer since they burned it down and got rid of that nasty Chinese takeaway that took up the shop front window. Now you have a nice big open space.  Only now all the walls are hard surfaces so the place is an echo chamber, making it impossible to hold a conversation without yelling at your partner.  And why does every restaurant in the Castro have to pretend to be a sports bar. Enough with the flat screens! I get they're cheap crowd-pleasers but go to The Mix if you want to watch the game.

And now for the main point. Service. Have these guys ever run a restaurant before? I ordered Tuna Sashimi, Salmon Sashimi and Agedashi Tofu and a glass of Sauvignon Blanc and my friend ordered California Rolls and a bottle of Sapporo. Nothing came as planned. Asahi Black came instead of Sapporo, while that was being sent back a random red wine came for me. Ok, with the drinks straightened out the food trickles in. "Special Sashimi" - a selection of 5 different fish came. sorry not ours. Then some rolls that looked like green hockey pucks (going with the sports theme?) came. Sent those back too. Then the Special Sashimi came back again. No takers? Then nothing for 20 minutes, our waiter studiously avoiding our stares.

We gave up at this point so I can't review the food. When we told the waiter we want to leave he just sighed and said "I'll bring the check". 

Yet another disappointing restaurant experiment in the Castro.
author: Duncan T.

description: i love this place, food is so good here! All of the fish are really good and fresh, plus their nice customer service! You will love to have dinner or lunch with your good friends. I am highly sugguest this is a good place to hang out either weekend or weekday.
author: Yvonne Z.

description: Great location in the heart of the Castro. Open and airy, the staff was very friendly and fast. Large selection of sake, ordered a $10 bottle that went down well. Ordered appetizers, soup and several maki rolls--the normal stuff: crazy maki, spice tuna--all were good. Rolls came before appetizers and soup, but the quality and quantity of the food was good. Reasonably priced and fast service.
author: Michael S.

description:
Been here twice now...first on a slow after lunch hours, and once for dinner.  I like 'em, food is yummy, and the presentation is beautiful.  Some new refreshing rolls that I haven't seen or eaten at other sushi places.  It's a nice addition to the Castro.

Service was excellent.
author: Tiberius A.

description: The only reason I am giving this place one star is for the kind and attentive waitress. The food is not authentic, not good, and not worth the money or calories. Tasted the Unaju don and chicken curry rice. Both were amateur.  Even the salad that came with the meal had an unappetizing dressing. Please skip this place and go to better nearby Japanese restaurants. You'll thank me.
author: Meisha B.

description:
3.5 stars. The miso tasted too much like chicken broth and the fish wasn't terribly fresh - so stick to the fried makimono. 

It has a nice atmosphere, and decent prices. I'm interested to try their curry. But given my choices for sushi in the city I would not come back here for the sushi.
author: Art W.

description: Have tried so many sushi places in SF and Wasabi is by far my favorite! They not only have the best sushi around (fresh & delicious), but they also have the best servers. Everyone is extremely kind and fun. I'm always bringing friends here to try it.
author: Tory P.

description: My husband and I love coming here during happy hour. The $1 oysters are so good, their california roll is made with real crab, and my all time fav is their agedashi tofu. Staffs are very friendly and the decor is very classy and nice. Definitely my go-to sushi spot!
author: Ella A.

description: I went the on my friend's birthday and the food was awesome. I love the sashimi, fresh, feeling like swimming in my mouth. Great place to go to for dinner.
author: Daniel L.

description: The food is good but the service was a bit slow.  This is are second time here and we really like the golden eye and the salmon and tuna tartare.  This time we also got the volcano roll which is our new favorite.
author: Mike E.

description: My first time here and it's was such a great a experience. The fish was extremely fresh and my steak was delicious.  Sake was so mmmmmmm good. Albert the manager came by and said hi and he was more than happy to see us first timers here. The presentation of the food was amazing and I'm definitely coming back for sure. Happy birthday Joey!!!! ;-). Did I mention the fish was very fresh ;-)
author: Josh Y.

description: Amazing Japanese ! California Roll had real crab...havent seen that in a while. Teriski Steak, calamari, garlic warm Edamame ....Tempura Peppers.... All fantastic. Happy hour 1$ oysters too. Im now a big fan!
author: Ronnie B.

description:
stay away from this place!!!
it takes a lot for me to be negative toward a business but last year 12/2014 I had a horrible experience with the head waitress.
when she approached to take my order i pointed twice to a menu item and verbally made my selection.
When the bill came they charged me around 38 dollars for the chefs special which i didnt order but apparently ate as it looked like what I ordered.  I was not happy with this or the service, I never got the miso soup that she suggested for me while ordering.
  but when the bill came I was shocked to see my 12$ menu item converted to the chefs special without my consent.  when I desputed the bill she refused to edit the charge to what I ordedred and was rude and nasty.
this was the most horrific dinning experience that i ever had and we eat out a lot.
If was planning to spend 38 $ for sushi i would have much rather go to the all you can eat buffet for 24$
if you go watch out for her I think she uses her language barrier as an excuse to pad the bill
I'll never go back nor will the friends that were with me witnessing all of this.  it ruined what was suppose to be a great evening at the gay men's chorus.   anyway the chorus was awesome as always so they saved the day.
author: Rob D.

description:
Nice Modern Design and ambiance but inexperienced service flubs and lackluster flavor in most dishes leaves room for improvement. 

This review is primarily focused on the happy hour menu.  But I feel if the menu fails in the happy hour most likely does not improve later on. 

 If you want ambiance and want to talk, and are not focused on the food's taste this maybe a good place - it never seems terribly busy. 

I love oysters and the $1 oyster happy hour special is what attracted me to try Wasabi Bistro.  I've been several times now - irresistibly drawn by the oyster appeal. The oysters are a nice size and taste ( drakes bay perhaps?) and it's served with a ginger green onion ponzu dressing.  The dressing is ok but I'd prefer  a traditional mignonette with shallots and champagne vinegar.  I wish they offered the option of more than one accompaniment.

I tried their house hot sake - a lil rough...

 One very good thing is their California roll made with very nice real & tasty snow-crab crab-meat.. I was pleasantly surprised and would come back just for the California roll.  

I decided to try some other appetizers on the menu - the fried chicken - Chicken Karaage and Tempura.  These were mediocre, not soggy but not tastyeither.  I think this place has room for improvement.  I love meat , especially fried chicken but I think this dish would be improved if the chicken were more bite-sized and the if the dish received a sprinkle of seasalt before service.  The Tempura was not as crisp as it should be and was rather flavorless.. this place should take a page out of Osaka Sushi's playbook up the street..

The service is strange here .. a mixture of attentiveness coupled with periods where you are ignored.  I think this awkward service is due to an inexperienced & untrained staff.. out of the 4 times I've been here my order has always somehow been messed up.  Once the sake I ordered failed to arrive until halfway through my dinner.  Another time the 12 oysters I ordered never came until I brought it to the attention of the staff.  Another time they removed my entree thinking I was done without asking me.  I will go back in the next month and see how things improve..  hope they are still around and get better.
author: Kenya P.

description: The food is pretty decent. I feel like it's the same choices you can get at Osaka. The sushi is good, and they seem to be big on the Sake. The staff is friendly, and it's an open bar.
author: Vinson H.

description:
Nice atmosphere and had good drinks!
I was not crazy about the food but great location and definitive will give it another try.
author: Todd J.

description:
Went here on New Years Eve for lunch.  

Service: 4
Speed:3
Friendliness: 5
Cleanliness : 5
author: Tommy H.

description:
My girlfriend and I were craving some sushi so we came here on a Saturday afternoon after a feature at the Castro theatre. It exceeded our expectations!

First of all it was happy hour, which they have every day so we got fresh food for excellent prices. I started off with some oysters ($1 each) and it was super fresh with zesty toppings. Definitely would go back for these. 

We also ordered a spicy tuna handroll ($2.95 each), Unago roll with mango and a Golden Gate Roll. Everything was fresh and tasty but the Unago roll was the most memorable and I'd come back for that too. 

We also got a large order of unfiltered sake which was only $4, super good deal. Our bill came to $23 so if you want fresh food at a good deal, happy hour at this place is a great idea! Plus you get free edamame! Seems like a good place for a date night too.
author: Rachel W.

description: Great for happy hour! Food was tasty and great ambiance for catching up with friends. Spacious too.
author: Sarah W.

description:
I've now eaten here twice now, both times being amongst the best dining experiences of all time. Their sashimi is the freshest and the best cuts. The spicy tuna I had the night before last has left me for a hankering I will have to satisfy during each successive visit.

The help is exemplary. I left a rare 25% tip after my last visit. This restaurant is under new ownership and extensively remodeled. The place is now truly beautiful and most accommodating. It is in the same location as another sushi place that I frequented for many years. As much as I liked the previous establishment, there really is no comparison.

Do yourselves a huge favor and head out for the Wasabi Bistro for your next night out to eat!
author: John N.

description: Had my birthday dinner here with friends last night.  We had a big bottle of sake and finished four bottles of champagne. The food are fresh and delicious as usual with excellent service. Albert the owner introduced some new dishes to us and they are so yummy.  Don't be afraid to ask him for recommendation when you get a chance to go there. I sure had a yummy and drunk birthday.
author: Kwok Y.

description: Worst experience. Wait 15mins for order. Wait almost 30mins for food. Wait 10 mins for check. Wait another 10 mins to get back to us with our cards. 15+30+10+10=1hour 5mins for one sushi dish. You've got to be kidding me.
author: Daniel K.

description: I was passing through the Castro and thought I'd try a new sushi place. I ordered takeout, only to find that not only were the menu prices lower than what was charged but also happy hour deals are only available for dine in customers. This was disappointing to say the least (for both incorrectly advertised menu options). When I received my food, I was disappointed to find that the sushi was relatively tasteless and subpar in general. Needless to say, I won't be going back.
author: Lea R.

description: I live just around the corner so of course I want this place to be great and for the most part it really is. I've been several times and always thought the food was quite good, but the service could be iffy and the prices are not cheap. However recently I've added Wasabi to my regular rotation of lunch spots, when prices are a bit more reasonable, the food seems even better and the service has been very attentive. Sushi options in the Castro are pretty limited, I think this is the best one.
author: Philip M.

description: I've tried ordering delivery from here a handful of times because they have a few dishes I really like. I was willing to give them the benefit of the doubt for being late the first two times but it seems that they habitually take FOREVER. When I order warm things they show up completely cold, with the inside of the bag filled with condensation...like my food has been sitting in somebody's car for over an hour. Not good when your primary ingredient is raw fish. I'm done with them after this last order of Chirashi. After an hour and a half wait time, the fish looked totally gnarly. Never had slimy skin left on my fish before. Yuck. And AGAIN, udon was stone cold. LAME.
author: H.S. G.

description:
I honestly think a 3.5 star rating is spot on for this restaurant. While I don't think the sushi is the best in the Castro (as some reviewers have pointed out) I definitely don't think it it's the worst. I went for lunch just the other day and the place was pretty empty. The waiter came over, greeted us, and answered all questions we had about the menu, which is always nice. He genuinely seemed happy to have his job, again a plus. 

I ordered the lunch special, which cost $12 and included a large salad, miso soup, bowl of rice, spicy tuna roll, and 4 pieces of nigiri. That's a pretty damn good lunch special. I asked what types of Nigiri would be given and he said it was the chef's choice so I asked for anything but eel (I hate eel!). He said that wasn't a problem and left. 

I agree with other reviewers in that the service is quite slow (we were the only ones in there) and the food was pretty mediocre. I mean, the sushi rice was pretty dry, but the nigiri was fresh and tasted good. I didn't like one of the nigiri pieces (albacore) and didn't eat it. When the waiter came back he was so apologetic I didn't like the albacore and offered to go get me a salmon slab of fish instead. I thought that was quite nice of him. We (my friend and I) split a spider roll, too and found it to be delicious.

In short, I'm glad I came for lunch and didn't have to spend a ton of money but If I'm in the Castro I'm probably not going to eat sushi; I'll save that for other spots within the city.
author: Tommy C.

description:
A friend had invited me to dinner here and I was pleasantly surprised since I don't venture into this part of town often, but now I don't mind making the trek over for Wasabi Bistro.  
They use fresh ingredients and you can tell they put a lot of attention in every aspect of their food, from quality and preparation, to presentation. I've tried something new each time and every dish has been impressive. My favorite has been the uni served on a spoon, gyutan izakaya, and baby lobster tail sushi. Their sashimi omakase is always fresh and in season. 
Great place to grab dinner and drinks with friends. Tip: Ask for the fresh wasabi, it brings out a different taste compared to the regular paste and not all places have it.
author: Anita C.

description: I'm going to keep this brief as I always do. This restaurant takes sushi to the next level with their Wagyu nigiri. It melts in your mouth like a sliver of congealed fat would and brings the consumer on a euphoric boat ride down Flavor River. The rest of their sashimi stock is also delicious and fresh, especially the Toro. I've eaten at several high end sushi bars and most of the fish here is prepared on par with those restaurants. One of the many highlights of the restaurant is the wasabi. It transcended the fish to a level enjoyed only by demi gods and up. Overall, I would definitely recommend this restaurant.
author: Chesley Z.

description: Are "waitress" Kai is amazing. Always has an excellent choice when trying something new. Very helpful and funny! You rock Kai!!
author: Ikaika B.

description: Great sushi and also the first place that I have seen sparkling sake which was also awesome.
author: Trent K.
