description: The environment is excellent, the food is fresh and delicious. when you look at the dishes, you may don't want to eat them because they look like artworks and just want to keep them... I like this place and enjoy the foods here!
author: Smile Y.

description:
This place is amazing. must try the wasabi scallops. 
Good service and beautiful place. 
very friendly and the food is all amazing!
author: Jessica W.

description: The waitress spilled my sake all over me and I still got charged for the whole bottle. She wasn't very apologetic either. Dining at Wasabi Bistro was a very disappointing experience today.
author: Aga B.

description:
This place tries to be a sports bar, dance club, and sushi restaurant.  The three big screen TVs are distracting, but the awful blaring music and sub par sushi are much worse.  Went there last week, the one and only time.  You're trying to eat and this godawful music is blasting through the speakers.  Vocoders and dubstep, I'd rather get a spinal tap.  If the sushi were good I wouldn't come back because of the music, but the sushi fails too.  The fish is not good.  They can't even get the rice right.  They overcook the rice til it becomes pasty, and they use it as their sticky rice.  I suspect that's what gives you the strange aftertaste.  Oh I almost forgot, the lighting.  Way too bright.  
If things stay this way, I don't think they'll be open very long.  As it is now it's just another bad restaurant in this neighborhood.
author: Jason D.

description: I ordered from here on EAT 24 the other night. After waiting an hour and half I had to call Eat 24 and have them track down what was supposed to be my 45-60 min order.  Another 30 min pass before the delivery gets here.  If you are going to miss your ETA delivery time, is it that hard to pick up the phone.  Of course the food that should be hot is cold and soggy.  What made this experience even worse was the driver wouldn't deliver it to my building.   He made me walk downstairs and out to his car to pick it up.  What piss poor customer service you people have.  At least the one sushi roll I had was pretty good.
author: Eric C.

description: Food is good, but the price is HIGH.  I think you can find comparable sushi places in SF without paying this steep price. The amaebi (sweet shrimp) was really good, and the heads were fried perfectly.  Uni was uber fresh. Godzilla Roll (recommendation) had multiple layers and had a nice level of heat.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Wasabi Bistro did a great job of remodeling the old All Season Cafe, aka The Cat and Rat.  The dinning room reminds me of restaurants in the Ginza District of Tokyo. Flashy and with a style all their own.
Food was very good, very fresh and the service was excellent.  
I'm not a huge fan of TV's in the dinning room, but I think I'm in the minority on this issue as just about every restaurant in the Castro has huge TV's on.
author: EC N.

description: had a great experience here the other night. Got a hankering for some Japanese style curry and was happy to find this place more or less right around the corner form me, when you usually I have to make the trip over to the Japan Town mall for my curry. The curry was among the best that I (and my brother) have ever had. Rich and flavor and delicious. Good stuff. It was a slow not and the service was very friendly, but also a tad on the slow side when not being friendly and talkative at our table, but we weren't in a real hurry, so it wasn't a big deal.  Good to know i have new curry joint so close to my house, I'll definitely be returning.
author: Andy H.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and I'm a big fan of Wasabi Bistro.  First off, for some reason whenever you go there the restaurant always has a table open (shhhh... don't tell anyone).  That's quite a rarity in the Castro and awesome to know that there's always a seat available at a good, reliable sushi place.  Second, the staff is really nice and the service (when you're in the restaurant) is always great.  On multiple occasions, the staff have either sent our table free edamame or given us a free sample of sake if we're having trouble deciding.  And, just last week, I was in there with a friend.  We were so deep in our conversation that we didn't realize it was already 11:20pm and the restaurant had closed.  I really appreciated that the folks there didn't rush us out and seemed happy to accommodate to us.
One last time, the Dragon Veggie roll is totally delicious and the salad dressing... I don't know what they put in it but, honestly, I can't get enough.  Yum, thanks Wasabi Bistro!
author: Allison S.

description: My girlfriend and I love Wasabi! We come here all the time because it has a great atmosphere and the staff is fun and attentive. Even when the restaurant is packed you will always get good service. The sushi is also very fresh for being moderately price. Come here for sushi if you are in the Castro, you won't regret it!
author: Caitlin B.

description: This place is amazing, crunch unagi roll and x roll are s'gooood. Delivery is pretty great too, always prompt.
author: Dinero A.

description: Amazingly fresh and excellent service. The uni and toro are among the best in the city. They never seize to disappoint me. Owners are also very interactive and they will always "ganbei" with you
author: Luffy L.

description: Great food! The sushi chef and the boss are super friendly too! Everything was very delicious.. Definitely going back there!
author: Yorbee H.

description: Been to various Japanese restaurant in San Francisco, by far this is the best in my opinion. Long list of variety to choose from and they are all delicious. Great environment, and staffs are very friendly.
author: Jun W.

description: I had a really lousy experience at this restaurant. First of all we only decided to come here for the happy hour which is 3-6PM and you can get $1 oysters. When we were seated it was a long time before we were acknowledged. I had to motion twice before our orders were taken, but after 15 minutes of waiting we were finally able to flag down a waitress. We were told that they weren't doign happy hour oysters today and when we asked why, she just said "we're just not doing it today." There should had been a sign outside or something indicating of the happy hour cancellation. We came all the way from Civic Center after Pride for nothing. So decided to just order something else. I had the seafood curry rice. I'll give this place 2 stars since the curry was fine, no complaints on the dish. When we were done, again I had to flag down a waitress for the bill. During the dining experience, our drinks we never refilled. They were fast on taking our money when we were done and yet slow on everything else including the service. This restaurant might be located in the heart of the Castro, but this place is FAR FROM FABULOUS. Won't be back.
author: Stephen C.

description: The food was pretty good. The server forgot 2 things that we ordered, and then blamed everyone but herself. I overheard other tables echoing the same sentiment. Sushi needs to be fresher; tasted oily and not today's catch. Will not be back.
author: David H.

description: Gave them another chance and this time it was good. I got my appetizer before my meal, main course was delivered promptly and the waitperson didn't disappear this time.
author: Kevin l.

description:
We went for happy hour. Ambient and interior look great, but the food didn't quite live up to that experience.

We ordered oysters on the half and a couple rolls (spicy tuna, tempura). Their oysters may have been some of the worst I've had. A bit bland and still hinged to their shells. Nothing really to rave about.

One more thing. I ordered a diet coke ($2.00) and got a refill, but was charged for 2 diet cokes. Not complaining about the extra $2 but a notice about no free refills would have been nice ...

All in all, I would probably give this place another shot, but wouldn't re-order any of the foods we ate today.
author: Larry C.

description:
EXCELLENT SUSHI AND ROLLS. 
The service was a bit haphazard. We arrived a bit before the end of happy hour and placed our drink order with Wendy. 10 minutes later another server arrived to ask if we needed anything. We explained we placed a drink order and were waiting for the drink delivery. Finally Wendy arrived and we placed our HAPPY HOUR order 10 minutes late. We never received one of our items and asked to have it removed from check. 
We placed an additional order of sushi and a Dragon Roll and never received two of the items we had ordered and when a another server approached the table to take dessert order we informed him that we never received our Enagi or our Salmon Roe. Poof!  They arrived.  All in all the food was fabulous. The service?  It seemed that all the staff were too preoccupied with the sushi bar guests and the remainder of the guests at the tables suffered.
author: Joseph F.

description: Definitely worth the five stars.. Reasonable price super fresh sushimi.  Highly recommend
author: Kristina F.

description:
This place ROCK!!!
They have great sushi and sashimi here. The fish are very fresh and tasty, lot of delicious dishes from the kitchen as well. 
I came here with a couple of friends and they all really like it. The service was great, Z was very attentive and funny. Will come back for happy hour to try it out. Good job guys.
author: Don M.

description:
I've eaten here twice so far and I was happy (and full) both times.

I like how they removed the take-out section in the front.  Having the picture windows in the front of the restaurant are great.  It feels like you are sitting outside without having to deal with the outside noise and uncomfortable weather during cold periods.  

My wife and I like to be surprised so many times we just ask the owner or manager for their best recommendations at that time.  Many times it's different because they will give us something that is fresh or in season.  There were a couple of times I asked for one of my typical sushi dishes and he would recommend something better.   It's kind of a team effort thing that we really aopreciate.

The food was great!  I like how creative some of their dishes are.  I don't really remember the names of the dishes because I just told the owner (Albert) to hook me up with some of the best stuff he can offer.  He did not disappoint us.  I just remember having various sushi and grilled dishes that I never had before and walked out of there totally stuffed and happy.  He actually comp'd me with a couple of dishes that were new and asked my opinion before adding it to the menu.

I did take photos of what I liked though so all I have to do is pull it up on my iPad and I'll get to re-experience the yummy dish I had before!  

As Arnie S. would say ... "I'LL BE BAACK!"  :)

P.S.  They are the sister restaurant to Wasabi and Ginger on Van Ness and Vallejo streets.  Their food and service are very good too.  One of the things I like there is that they have FREE valet parking!
author: K C.

description:
This is the sister restaurant of Wasabi and Ginger on Van Ness.

Wasabi Bistro opened in October 2012 and of course I was skeptical of another restaurant in the Castro.

I have been to the Bistro 5 times and I think it's one of the best, freshest Japanese food in San Francisco.

Beautiful presentation, fresh sushi, and they even make their own soy sauce.
author: Kenneth W.

description: This place was amazing! Brought out all the dishes on point! The fried California roll... Amazing. Try it! :)
author: Alex K.

description: Back to this nice restaurant again. Owner recommended some great food. We enjoyed the x mas dinner. Definitely will come back.
author: Timothy L.

description: Great food but a bit too pricy like any other Japanese restaurants. The service was excellent and the food I had as well. I had some good curry that was nice and spicy. I loved their miso soup and their sushi's too. The atmosphere was very diverse in terms of people who come from different walks of life. The space is very nice and romantic...
author: Ahrmon R.

description:
GREAT CLASSY Place to go to with friends!!! I do like the interior and i also love the vegetarian options to this place!!! I ordered a lot of Vegetarian substitions to the sushi they served here and the staff was happy to accomodate me!!

Great place to dine at!
author: Sophia W.

description: On Saturday we had a party of 20 for my husband's 40th birthday. The food was delicious and reasonably priced. The only reason why I'm not giving 5 stars is because the food delivery time was off.  My mother in law had to wait at least 20 min to get her ribs after everyone else received their food. Overall it was a great experience and would recommend it.
author: laura q.

description: Ordered delivery from this place and they said it would take an hour. After an hour and a half I called to check on the order. They then told me it would be another hour. Don't use delivery from here.
author: Nick S.

description: The food was great. I do recommend Wasabi if you want sushi. It was fresh, creative and delicious. But be careful if you get delivery! I was informed by the delivery guy that they only deliver within 2 miles, and apparently I live outside of that range. Well, sorry, but if I go to Grubhub and your restaurant is listed and I am able to order, then I assume that I live with the parameters that you set up when you agreed to have your establishment linked to a delivery site. Oops- what was I thinking? I feel that they graciously agreed to deliver my food as a first time customer, but was then told not to order delivery again. You got it! I will never order from Wasabi Bistro ever again.
author: Mick Z.

description:
Food was good but service was SLOW. It seemed we waited 15 minutes between each dish. It was a relatively slow evening as not all tables were occupied. I had to ask twice for soy and napkins. Dishes were not removed promptly. The appetizer was served mid-meal.

Another curiosity is the TV's showing sports. Huh? I suggest they take the TV's down and replace them with artwork.

Bottom line is I will go again simply because the food IS good. Maybe the service will be better next time. But there won't be a third if they don't improve the service.
author: Casbah Y.

description: The service at this place is incredible. Super friendly and welcoming. Food is good and delivers fast. Ambiance is good. But seriously love going here mainly because they r soooooooo super duper nice. :)
author: Samira N.

description: Very fresh deluxe sashimi that came with great fresh cuts of a great variety of fishes.  Well worth the price!  The rainbow roll was also excellent!  Sat at the bar, service was friendly.  Fresh wasabi came with the deluxe sashimi.  Will go back.
author: Edmond T.

description: Good Service and Good Food.  Especially sashimi...fresh n yummy!!  The Grill food is very special and tasty.  Envirnoment is quiet and modern.
author: Carrie K.

description: Great Sushi and Sashami. I'm always looking for excellent quality Sashami and have found it here. Good service, nice ambiance and enjoyable Sake. I recommend coming here for a meal with 1 friend or several. I've been here for lunch and dinner and it's always the best.
author: Joanne F.

description:
Terrible delivery service. Ordered at 6:05pm, told that my meal would arrive in 40 min. It didn't arrive until 7:45 - 100 minutes later! 

  I called to check on the status of my delivery twice and was told both times it was almost there - not so in either case.

By that time it finally arrived, the sashimi was warm and mealy and the soup was cold.

To their credit the manager did try to fix the situation when I called to complain. They spoke with the owner and called me back to let me know they wouldn't be charging me for the meal, which was nice.
author: C B.

description: So surprised to see the mixed reviews here.  I am just coming from Wasabi Bistro again and I have to say it is truly the best sushi in the Castro...and pretty good all around.  Very fresh, high quality and nice portions.  The omakase sushi and sashimi plates are really the best options.  The Omakase Sushi is 7 plump pieces of the best options of the day for $21.95.  Very reasonable for the quality.  Some of the rolls are quite special and delicious.  A few pointers based on past experience.  First, I have always had a better experience at the sushi bar rather than the tables.  Second, some of the specials can be a bit pricey (for example the Toro Tartare).  If you take the staff suggestions regarding a special...just be sure that you know the price.  The quality of the sashimi and sushi that I have had at the Wasabi Bistro sushi bar can't be beat in the neighborhood.
author: Aaron C.

description: Wasabi Bistro is like my local bar. I go here at least once a week and have become friends with the people who work there. The food is always good (best California rolls) and it's the perfect spot to drink some cold beer and hot sake. I even watched the superbowl here - they have TVs above the bar if you need to catch a game. The service is always on point every time and the wait staff is extremely friendly!
author: Lauren F.

description: Very poor service. The food is fine, but we will no longer give this place our business because of "Wendy" the waitress and her condescending attitude. She doesn't answer customer questions and is very rude to everyone. It's surprising that this person still has a job.
author: T K.

description: Excellent service! The castro roll is my FAV! The fried calamari is finger licking good!!!
author: Fiona S.

description: The food was delicious, the service was great and the music was popping. I would definitely go back!!! Highly recommend this restaurant to my friends.
author: Thai Q.

description: Great service, fantastic food! Definitely coming here again. Probably my favorite sushi restaurant. Great owner and staff.
author: Derrick C.

description: Delicious food, nice ambience, good prices and friendly staff.  Will definitely be back.
author: Richard H.

description:
I've been here once and can't wait to go again! They took fantastic care of my friends and me. The food was excellent and the service was even better. This is even more impressive when you consider they haven't been open for very long. Wasabi Bistro definitely knows what they're doing.

See you soon.
author: Eric M.

description: Wow!!! That is all I can say. The fish... Fresh. The ambiance... Beautiful. The chefs Jesse and Dragon (I think that's his name) were amazing. Not only were their dish captivating but their preparation was impeccable. Definitely coming back. PS if you like uni and ankimo get the shooter tasting... It's to die for
author: Patrick N.

description: I love this place!!! Fast service, nice waiters and Jessie at the sushi bar said I looked like Wolverine... He gets extra bonus points for that.  But seriously great food and on a Friday don't be fooled by the lack of people just because they are fools not being here. Yum!!!
author: Gilbert P.

description: We just finished a meal from Wasabi. My wife spent a year in Japan. She said this was one of the most authentic soba's she's had in the states. The sushi was fresh. And very reasonably priced. I would absolutely order again
author: T M.

description: Came in here for the happy hour with my boyfriend, and we got a dozen HH $1 oysters and the nigiri sampler. They brought out some free edemame and we munched on that while we waited for our food. The nigiri came out first; I think they let one of the apprentices cut the fish because some of the cuts were crooked. Not the prettiest sushi, but I guess you get what you pay for. The oysters were decent. Overall, not a bad happy hour, but nothing to go out of your way for.
author: Rebecca L.

description: If you're in the mood for Japanse during the brunch hours then this is your spot. Quality food, decent prices and never too crowded.
author: Lee R.

description: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place! It's one of the best places to get the chirashi bowls. Great price and great sushi! My family members ordered things other than sushi and they all really enjoyed their meals! Always looking forward to going there again!
author: Chris H.

description: It's a very nice and trendy looking place. I love that they are open till 1 pm but for the food you get (quality and quantity) it is not really worth the price.
author: William N.

description: Great sushi in the Castro. Excellent fish. Terrific service! Can't wait to come back! Andy is the best!!!
author: Jesse S.

description: What a great place! The sushi is fantastic and the staff is exceptionally friendly. The Country Roll was so good! I can't wait to go back and try some more!!
author: Amy N.

description:
Pros
-Oysters were very fresh
-Decor and dinnerware are very modern
-Calamari came with onions and jalepeno peppers

Cons
-Wouldn't honor lunch specials even though there was no time limit on lunch specials  (I got there around 3)
-Service was very slow
-Brought out my miso and oysters with my meal (I had wanted them for an appetizer)
-My hot food was cold by the time I finished off poorly-timed appetizers
-Sushi rice needed vinegar
-Tea was cold - I asked for hotter tea and it took 6 minutes. The waitress warned me it was dangerously hot. I took a sip, it was perfect. Not sure why she thought the luke-warm tea was hot to begin with. She thought I was insane when I wanted it hotter.

All in all, while it was not a bad place to eat, I doubt I'll be back. The wait staff are immature and they need to focus on improving their skills (ie, bring out hot tea when it's hot, bring appetizers at the beginning of a meal, etc).
author: Nate T.

description: Just amazing! Service, ambiance, food... Simply wow in my opinion!!! Definitely a must to try :)
author: Irina K.

description: I will say i was totally surprised about how wonderful the food was here. The take out place is gone, but this really beautiful upscaled Bistro came in and a great addition to the hood. Dee had the raw fish stuff (YUK) and loved it all and I had the Chicken and the steak and it was really great. I know it looks really out of place from the outside but really the servers and cook amazing food .
author: Randy M.

description: I was really pleasantly surprised. Ordered via Seamless.  The sashimi was really fresh and tasty (definitely best I've had on Seamless for sure), as were the baked mussels. Great looking menu with other things I'd like to try.
author: Xue H.

description: The ambiance was nice, the menu looked good. The food was mediocre, but definitely some interesting choices to pick from. Will definitely give this place another try.
author: yana Z.

description: This place is awesome! The environment is very unique and I love how everything is brand new. They have a large selection of appetizers and I LOVE the garlic shrimp. The waitress was very knowledgable of the menu and she introduced us to many signature dishes. I can't remember her name but she has short hair with glasses, I highly recommend her costumer service and she was down to earth and took a sake shot with my friends and I. I love an environment where everybody are friendly and just trying to have a great time.
author: Sandy L.

description:
pretty good sushi.  the service here is reallllly friendly and the atmosphere is pretty swanky.  a bit expensive, but hey you're in the castro!  would like to see some more creative rolls like osaka down the street

Edit: why 3 stars,
This place is inconsistent. I reviewed it after the first time I went but have been back a few times. The fish isn't always fresh
author: Chantel B.

description:
Found this place while walking down the castro and it was AWESOME! The sushi was  amazing and the staff is extremely nice! The ambiance is great for date night or hanging out with friends. Super cute and hip! Ended up staying passed closing because of all the fun we were having and they didn't even kick us out! And their deep-fried green tea ice cream is DELICIOUS!!!!


It's right by all the bars and clubs so it's a great place to grab dinner and drinks with friends before a night out! :)
author: Cassie B.

description: The food is very good. The ppl here are supper friendly. Services is great and reasonable price.
author: Sa C.

description: Love this place! Great food and good service! The happy hour is great and can't beat the price and quality, give it a try
author: Jamie D.

description: Highly recommended! Great environment! Fast service with delicious sushi and rolls! Especially the wasabi shrimp! It's delusions!
author: Huijie L.

description: I really like their sashimi, is really really fresh, and rolls are good too! I will come bak!
author: JLing L.

description: Very good service! The sashimi is fresh~  and they have a lot of special rolls! Especially the Costco roll! Highly recommended!!!! Definitely will go back!
author: Kam L.

description: The best sushi I've had in a long time. Creative and beautiful presentation, very tasty food, great specials, and excellent friendly service. The owner checks in to see how your meal is and he really cares. I'll be back soon!
author: Larry J.

description: FINALLY! A unique sushi place! I've sampled a lot of different sushi places in my time. Wasabi Bistro had a refreshing menu with new and exciting rolls, great beer, and a great selection of nigiri sushi. I will go back again and again.
author: Kyle F.

description: This restaurant has, by far, the best service I've ever experienced. The workers had welcoming smiles on their faces and the environment is very comfortable and relaxing. The food is through the roof! Really filling and delicious. Don't forget to try the desserts, I especially recommend the sorbet with white chocolate cover. It's unique and I guarantee you won't regret it. :)
author: Kashille S.

description:
The only reason I'm giving it 1 star is because Yelp doesn't allow 0 stars, which is what place deserves.

First off, it's run by Chinese -- so it's not even close to authentic Japanese sushi.  Secondly, everyone there is pushy and trying to get you to order the thing that they suggest -- even though you've told them three times you're not interested in cream cheese in your maguro roll and no, you don't like deep-fried sushi rolls.  Fish tastes fresh, but there's so much rice surrounding it that you can hardly taste it.  The only good thing was abundant green tea :) 

Definitely worth skipping!
author: Mike Y.

description: HIGHLY recommend!!!  A combination of freshness and the variety of foods, plus  excellent of services just make you can't wait to go back.  And best of all, it's very reasonable prices.  I extremely like the assortment of sashimi,  very very fresh!!!!!!
author: Sue N.

description:
nice people.  horrible lighting....made your skin looked green.  fish was good but mushy rice....like white paste.

and why tvs??????? enough already, people don't need to constantly watch tv.  it cheapens the place and the music was horrible.

other than that had a great time.
author: Vincent C.

description:
This place is awesome! I was there with two of my friends last night. The sashimi was super fresh and nicely presented. The rolls we tried were delicious. I loved the Truffle Oil infused Hirame Sashimi & Ankimo.  Great selection on Sake.  Most of all, the service was excellent.  
Found out they have happy hour starting at 11am with $1 oyster.  I will definitely go back again for their happy hour.
author: W W.

description: I believe this restaurant opened its doors about a week ago and so we thought we'd give it a shot on its first Saturday night dinner.  Appears they've put in quite a bit of work and invested a good sum of money to update this restaurant.   The food was quite good: the sushi seemed fresh, rolls were good, and gilled very salmon flavorful.  The restaurant was quite full but didn't feel too crowded (a little loud with the music but not too bad).  The restaurant itself was well kept and clean as well as food nicely presented on the dishes.  I do think the service was somewhat disorganized, but I'll give them the benefit of the doubt that they'll work through this since they've only been open a few days and they did seem to have plenty of waitstaff to handle the crowd.  Within a few weeks, I'm sure they'll have all the kinks worked out and running a smooth operation.
author: Kent W.

description: I went in over the weekend and I was taken care of by Andy the sushi Chef! He was great! not just because of the yummy eats, but also because he was genuinely interested in having rapport with patrons. Great place and you get what you pay for!
author: Mauricio V.

description:
- food: fresh / creative
- atmosphere: lots of mirrors / loud music
- staff: pleasant and responsive
- price: reasonable for sushi

additional info:
- 49er roll was a standout
author: J. B.

description: Wasabi Bistro serves delicious, inventive Japanese food -- a large selection of rolls, sushi and sashimi, tempura and skewers. Everything we ordered was delicious and the service was prompt and personal, despite the fact that the place was packed on a Friday night. Be sure to order the bacon wrapped shrimp and a couple of their rolls. Beer, wine and sake are available and there are booths and tables. All the staff were extremely pleasant and professional. Get there before it's reviewed and becomes impossible to get into.
author: Kenneth O.

description:
I live in the Castro and I've avoided going into this place because I honestly thought it looked tacky, but we decided to give it a whirl last night and boy am I glad we did! The food was nothing short of excellent, particularly the sashimi sampler and the AMAZING Golden Eye, which a salmon wrap with snow crab, shiso, mango and tobiko. Quite possibly the most delicious thing I've ever eaten. Our waitress, Wendy, was incredibly knowledgeable and gave us very helpful tips, including which things really shouldn't be dipped in soy sauce so that their flavor could be properly savored. They also have REAL WASABI in addition to the paste one almost always gets, which is a nice treat. We were actually the only customers there, which was sad and in due in part to the war zone of the Castro, which is being completely torn up and renovated these days, so I can't speak for how the service might be if it was crowded but for us it was perfect. 

So we gorged on a lot of food and had a $30 bottle of sake that seemed magically bottomless, and the meal came to $100 for the two of us, which seems very reasonable. We will definitely be back! I'm surprised to see so many negative reviews here. I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 only because we're in San Francisco and that does not do justice to the truly extraordinary restaurants we have here.
author: James W.

description: Came to Wasabi Bistro the first week of opening and the service was still getting up to speed so it wasn't all that great. However when I made a trip here again, it seems like the manager has done a better job at managing the service and I had a pleasant dining experience with a couple of my friends. The shrimp and scallops from the kitchen are wonderful and the fish is all fresh. I will definitely be back again.
author: Norman S.

description: The interior.is a bit much for me, however the food is the reason why I come 1 or 2 days a week for lunch.. Not a mediocre meal so far. Love the Katsu. And the service is on the ball!
author: Patrick S.

description:
Went here on a Monday night... It was fairly quiet, maybe 10-12 tables. The decor was nice, the menu is honestly on the expensive side for what you get... But I really wouldn't expect much else in the Castro.

My date ordered some sushi for main course, and I ordered one of the entrees (pork katsu). His sushi came out in about 5-10 minutes. Fifteen (!!!) minutes later, I still hadn't received any soup or salad, much less my entree.

We had a hard time flagging down someone to help us (despite eight people front of house that we counted). We mentioned that none of my food had come out yet, waiter was apologetic, went to the back and immediately returned with my entree.

When I mentioned that I didn't receive my soup or salad still, they were surprised and brought them out immediately.

As for the quality of the food, mine was mediocre at best. Under-seasoned katsu that was soggy on the bottom (I'm guessing it was sitting out for a while). Pretty much flavorless. Date said that the sushi wasn't bad, fairly standard.

The management was very apologetic for the mess up with my food, and comp'd us our sake. They offered us free dessert too.

All said, I think they really have to work on the quality of their food for the prices they are charging, and their communication between the front and back of house. Having 8 people milling about that haven't noticed a half-served table is pretty unacceptable.

Doubt I'll return.
author: Will C.

description: I'm sure the food here would have been amazing but unfortunately I didn't get to try it. I had ordered a bunch of food to eat after work and was waiting for it to arrive when I got a call about 10-15 mins later. They were calling to say that they were busy, I was too far, it would take over an hour for me to get my food, and they would charge me an extra 5 dollars because of how far away I am. I'm not sure how eat24 works with their restaurants or whose fault this would be but don't state there would be free delivery or say you can deliver to a location just to call and say I'm too far and will be charged for it. Also the lady on the phone was nice and I'm sure she was thinking of me when telling me about my order but I still got the impression that they didn't want to deal with this order. They rather me cancel it than for them to come out all that way. You guys should change whatever it is your range on eat24 is because that's just horrible. To top it off they didn't even properly cancel the order so I would have still been charged if I didn't contact eat24 myself. Horrible and unprofessional. Hopefully your food was good enough to gather those stars because it sure wasn't the way you handle business.
author: Alyssa A.

description: I would recommend this restaurant. Service was great and fish was fresh. The wedges of mochi ice cream at the end of our meal really topped off the whole experience.
author: Betty C.

description: Good place, friendly staff and fresh tasty sushi. Thay have a good happy hour too
author: Damion B.

description: I've been a sushi eating local for 6 years now and this is one of the best Sushi bars I have been to in years. The staff is very nice and Tony was very entertaining and helpful. The sushi chef is a young cute guy which helps in any situation and he is very skilled with the ever so fresh fish. Try the Hawain butter fish wih Fresh real wasabi, I couldn't stop eating it. I got some hot Sake with my lunch and the owner kept buying me more on the house! The rice is perfect, when it was All season sushi before, they never got the rice right but the new owner has it golden!  They have a huge variety of cold sake as well. The atmosphere is nice and slick and modern except for the two 1980's ALL you eat Chinese Buffet Crystal Chandeliers hanging from the cealing are the downfall of the look. Great place for those who like great sushi, they should think about having a wesite and delivery.
author: Shaun A.

description:
boys town sushi. checked it out after it was open for a couple of months and had to wait and wait and wait while all the boys seated all around us (and AFTER us) got waited on first. bullshit.

that aside, the sushi was pricey and i can't attest to the freshness of any of the rolls because it was all the touristy kind. you know - clever names with tempura this and eel sauce that on it. stuck to the sashimi, which was not mind-blowingly fresh. which for the price, it damn well should have been.
author: Will R.

description: The food is delicious and fresh here. The sushi and sashimi here was great, the miso salmon sushi is a must try. Service was great and will definitely be back again!
author: Kevin T.

description: Really sad as it appears the owners spent a great deal of money on the remodel.  The service was friendly, however their sushi was very unremarkable.  The seafood is of poor quality as were the sushi rolls.
author: Eli B.

description: I had the best experience at Wasabi Bistro! I Love it there. I went there for my birthday and I had a blast! The waiter was so sweet and the food was well made and delicious! They even surprised me with a cake!!!!!! I highly recommend this place whenever you are in Castro!
author: Jason D.

description: Decided to try something new and get out of our neighborhood.  Great selection of sushi and sides. I think our favorite was called the "Pink Lady". The staff  was also really friendly. Can't wait to go back :)
author: Tiffany G.

description:
My son and I stopped in for a late lunch and it turned out to be happy hour. We hit some happy hour items but put ourselves into our servers hands. We had to have Shima Aji and OToro sashimi and a sashimi platter. The oysters were excellent because my son ate four out of five. The Toro had just come in so it came last as it needed preparing and cutting but I were very pleased when it arrived. We had Chicken Karaage, a Hawaiian roll that had butterfish and baby scallops, and pineapple and usually fruit in sushi is a disaster, but it was light and fresh and scrummy. All of our fish was of excellent quality, exceedingly fresh, generous portions, hon-maguro to die for, and the robata was very well cooked and spiced. The Toro was amazing. Fresh wasabi, caviar and fresh sweet belly!Great sake selection and the server, again steered me to a  short bottle. 
Great owner, helpful and friendly staff and we will return and sit at the sushi bar. They could tell we were all about the fish.
Go!
author: Edward C.

description: I love to eat sushi and this place has the best raw fish I've ever tasted. I'll definitely come back again with my family.
author: Jessica M.

description: Way too noisy on a Saturday night. Stupid, unnecessary music, food ok, but service very bad: for our 6 people, took 30 minutes for half the group to get their food. Vegiie rolls boring and tasteless, although the rest of our group liked their food. Uncomfortable booths, decor that looks like it is a disco. Will not go back.
author: sheila m.

description: I was very pleasantly surprised by this sushi spot.  The fish was very fresh, the rolls were delicious and the sashimi was amazing.  I highly recommend the fresh oyster.
author: Yuri K.

description: The food was amazing and the staff was very attentive. We ate dinner at the bar and the chef was very interactive, which made us feel at home. This was the third time for us to eat here and each time we have never been disappointed. We certainly eat here again and continue to support this wonderful restaurant.
author: Derek V.

description: Awesome sashimi!! So happy that a quality sushi place opened in Castro! Try their Salmon/Tuna tartare & lobster tail sushi.
author: A D.

description: We went here for brunch.  It is still new, and the place was empty.  I was really disappointed - the poke had way too little seasoning, and the sushi, while fresh, was something you could get at the super market.  The presentation of the food was also very unappealing and very non-Japanese.
author: B Y.

description: You got to try this place. I was there the other day and ordered combo sashimi. Fish is fresh and unique. Chef's special sushi roll is very tasty.  Fried ice cream desert is yummy. The atmosphere is quiet and romantic.. I will go there with my friends again.
author: Polar B.

description: Please turn down  the music. Fine dining in a nicely appointed restaurant should not be a  loud concert hall. The food and service are fine. But the noise level is deafening.Mentioned the noise called music to the Host. They want to be a sports bar.Keep this up and they will be no bar or restaurant.
author: jay d.

description: Finally had a chance to stop in for lunch and it was well worth the visit. I ordered the Omakase 10pc lunch to see what the sushi chefs were featuring today and it's absolutely a dish this restaurant can be proud of. It was some of the freshest sushi you'll find in town and amazingly, it's served with delicious bright green fresh wasabi (the pale ground version has more horseradish in it).  I see that some Yelpers complained about pricing but my lunch was very fairly priced for their excellent quality fish. If freshness is essential to you and you would never think of cutting corners on sushi, you will love this place.  I also had a spectacular salmon roll with fresh (super fresh!) dungeness crab, mango and roe.  I think it's called the Sun Roll. Unique and excellent.  My server was friendly, professional and attentive. I will go back and bring friends for sure.  Check it out while there is still no wait.  It will be packed as soon as the word gets out.
author: Chiara D.
